strIntroduction: I’m happy to report that the geisha world is alive and well in Kabukicho! Only these days it’s populated by gorgeous young guys whose job it is to entertain women like the princesses we wish we were. What is a Host club and Kabukicho? - Host clubs offer the possibility to spend time with a professional, a so-called "host". These "hosts" work in "host clubs", and their purpose is to entertain the female guests and make them feel special. Hosts are really good at making conversation, but they’re even better at listening. They are masters at making you feel like you are the most interesting, attractive woman in the world. They’re masters at creating an atmosphere of friendship/flirtation. Usually they sit across the table and talk, but occasionally one will sit next to you instead and you’ll learn the meaning of the Japanese word “doki doki”! - Shinjuku Kabukicho Glowing with neon lights every night, Shinjuku Kabukicho is known as the city that never sleeps. Located in the Shinjuku area, Kabukicho is Japan's largest entertainment district. There are many restaurants, amusement facilities and movie theaters. Also Kabukicho is the largest red-light district in Japan, without the official red-light prostitutes. But it has a very different atmosphere compared to red-light districts in Europe. Your guide book might say Shinjuku Kabukicho and the Host club area are not safe areas, and usually travel agencies don't do guides here. But these areas have a very special and unique atmosphere and it's a much safer place now than it once used to be. ●Tour days and time: Monday to Friday Starting time is 6:30 pm or 7:00pm ●Meeting point: JR Shinjuku station, East exit, outside tickets gate, NEWDAYS SHOP. If you are coming by walking, go to JR Shinjuku station, East gate entrance. You will see Police box, KOBAN next to East gate entrance. Go down to the stairs in the entrance. Then you will see the NEWDAYS Shop. ●The duration of this tour 2 hours ●Cost inclusions: Included only guide fee. Host club fee, drinks and food are NOT included. Please pay for host's meals and host club fee during the tour. Host club fee depends on the club. It is about 5000 JPY. If you have any questions or would like further information for my tours, please send a message. ★You need to have your ID card with you★ The club have to check if the guests are older than 20 years old. If you are under 19 years old you cannot go to host clubs.
strTitle: Visit a Host Club in Shinjuku: Lady's night life with locals

strIntroduction: Below is the information about the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and the optional add-on Tuna Auction Tour. Please note the Tuna Auction Tour is only available as an add-on with the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. Bookings for same day or the day before is difficult, so please book ahead. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Tsukiji Fish Market Tour: Restaurants in Uogashi-Yokocho were originally for dealers and chefs who visited the market for purchasing their dish ingredients. Recently, those restaurants are earning a well-respected reputation among Japanese citizens and tourists for its fresh and high-quality dishes. Although Uogashi-Yokocho houses appear simple and humble, the long wait lines are proof of the intense popularity for these fresh and reasonably priced sushi dishes. The guide Kiyoshi will guide you every step of the way throughout the fish market, full of endless rows of fish, fruits, and vegetables. He'll teach you the history of Tsukiji and the food industry in Japan from his many years of experience working in hospitality! Detailed Itinerary: 7:00am - Start Tsukiji Market tour 7:30am - Fruits and vegetable market 8:00am - Visit Uogashi Yokocho 8:30am - View Namiyoke Shrine 9:00am - Explore the Fish market 9:30am - End of the tour ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Optional Add-on - Tsukiji Tuna Auction: *Closed from mid-December 2015 to beginning of January 2016. Experience the energy and excitement of Tokyo's premier Tuna Auction at the infamous Tsukiji Fish Market with a professional and knowledgable tour guide! The guide Kiyoshi will guide you every step of the way to watch the Tuna Auction and teach you about the history of Tsukiji and the food industry in Japan from his many years of experience working in Japan's Hotel and Food & Beverage industry. Be one of the first people to arrive at the Tuna Auction site at 3am to reserve your spot and see first hand as the early morning brokers check deep inside the famous tuna using flashlights as they assess the quality before the Tuna Auction. Then witness the infamous Tuna Auction between 5:30am and 6:00am. Participants will be able to experience this exciting daily event live and see the extravagant prices paid for high-quality tuna. After watching the Tuna Auction, you will complete your morning with sushi for breakfast at a highly-recommended restaurant. The sushi will surely be the freshest fish you have ever eaten! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Closed Dates in 2015: January 7, 12, 21, 28 February 4, 11, 18, 25 March 4, 11, 25 April 8, 15, 22, 29 May 4, 5, 13, 27 June 3, 10, 17, 24 July 8, 20, 29 August 14, 15, 26 September 9, 21, 22 October 7, 12, 28 November 3, 11, 18, 23 December 9, 23, 31
strTitle: Private Tokyo Tsukiji Market Tour

strIntroduction: Do you want to see the most high energy, futuristic, out-of-this-world show in Tokyo? Of course you do! The Robot Restaurant, or Robot Cafe, is just a short walk from Shinjuku station, at the heart of the Kabukicho district, and is an experience that you won't find in any other city in the world! Also known as the "robot cabaret", it is one of the most visited entertainment spots in Tokyo among foreign guests! All bookings through Voyagin will receive 1 free drink with each ticket! As soon as you arrive you're treated to a sensory overload of colors, designs, glitter and jewels. Even the air vents are covered in bling! After marveling at the wonderful over-the-top design of the $10 million venue, you'll enjoy a spectacular musical performance including bikini-clad troupes of taiko drummers, building up to the main robot show overflowing with lasers, drums, amazing robots, battling women, wild costumes, and much more. It's like something out of a sci-fi movie and no expense has been spared in making it the wildest and weirdest show in town. Finally after all the excitement, you can gather your wits by unwinding in our super-glitzy lounge area after the show. If you're not amazed, entertained, baffled, and blown away, you need to get your pulse checked because this is guaranteed to be one of the most outlandish experiences of your time in Japan. We hope you are able to join us for a show and have a fantastic experience here! ※Bento menu: Sushi. (There is no vegetarian menu.) ※Please note, if you booked for a show the same day we will not be able to prepare a Bento Box for you, although you can still get snacks and drinks for the show. ※Although one free drink is included, no food is included in the price shown - snack are available throughout the show and you can order a 'bento' meal in advance when you make your reservation. ※ You CANNOT cancel your Bento Box after the cancellation due date (48 hours prior). You MUST pay 1000yen/bento for your Bento Box fee at the entrance if you booked for this option. ※Please arrive 15 minutes before the show starts. After the main show commences late entry will not be permitted. Here are the cut-off entry times for each show - 3:45pm for 3:20pm show (Main Show starts at 4:00pm) 5:40pm for 5:15pm show (Main Show starts at 5:55pm) 7:35pm for 7:10pm show 8Main Show starts at 7:50pm) 9:30pm for 9:05pm show (Main Show starts at 9:45pm) ※Please note this price is inclusive of the 15% discount offer. ※Music Live show will start 40 minutes before Robot show starts. ※Once the show starts, you will not be allowed to leave the venue. If you book the last show at 9:05pm, please consider the last public transport time as the show ends at 11:15pm. Sample of the program (5:15pm show) - 5:15pm - Music Performance starts 5:55pm - Main Show Starts: Part 1 6:25pm - Part 2 Starts 6:55pm - Part 3 Starts 7:25pm - Show ends Children below the age of 3 are able to enter for free. There will be no seat allocated to the child and he/she will need to sit on one of the parents' lap
strTitle: 15% OFF Discount Ticket for Robot Restaurant Shinjuku Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have a kayak and snorkeling adventure in Blue Cave, Okinawa! Enjoy the sunny beach and marvel at the glowing blue ocean in between crevices and tunnels. Here is the itinerary: - Gather at our handmade marine house. - Get into a kayak and row out towards the "Blue Cave". Enjoy a panoramic view of cliffs, coastlines, and subtropical plants while you leisurely row your kayak. - When a huge cave appears, kayak onto the shore nearby and have some tea. - Snorkeling practice in the ocean near the shore. - Head towards Okinawa ocean! - Enjoy snorkeling, play with tropical fish, explore the mysterious and magical Blue Cave with sunlight glistening from the bottom. This tour departs at 8:30, 10:30, 13:30, and 15:00 every day. Please state your preferred timing when you make your booking, and if you require pickup, your hotel in Onna village. If you're staying outside Onna village, please come to the meeting point by bus or taxi. Let's enjoy amazing Kayak and Snorkel in Okinawa! We're looking forward to hearing from you!
strTitle: Kayak and Snorkel in Blue Cave, Okinawa

strIntroduction: Maricar is a go-kart rental service, where you can enjoy cosplay and driving if you have a driver’s license. You can wear the Mario costume and go anywhere you want driving Mario Kart on the public road. There is no doubt that you will stand out in such vivid, unique Mario Kart. Put your costumes on, play your favorite love songs on loud speakers, and drive around your favorite part of town in Tokyo! The Real Life Mario Kart is coming true! There are free options: GPS car navigation (if available), action camera, loud sound speakers (if available), helmet, mask, and glasses. If you drive with your friends or families, the wireless applications can also be rented for a fee. Business Hours: 10:00-22:00 Note that the go-kart activity will not be available after 10 pm, therefore book earlier if you want to enjoy your entire requested time. For example, if you want to book a 2-hour tour, the latest possible time for booking will be 8 pm. Please note that: ※ You must have a valid Japanese drivers license, Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit based on the 1949 Geneva Convention*. ※Bring a valid Japanese or SOFA license, or International Driving Permit* and a copy of your passport (passport is not required for Japanese) to the shop on the day *Holders of a license from Belgium, France, Germany, Monaco, Slovenia, Switzerland or Taiwan can use an official Japanese translation provided by the Japan Automobile Federation (JAF) or the country’s embassy or consulate in Japan. The plan include 2-hour rental, English guide, costume, and fuel (you do not need to fill up the tank when returning). Insurance fee is included in the price. Third Party Liability = Unlimited Guest himself/herself = up to JPY 30,000,000 Disclaimer = JPY 50,000
strTitle: Enjoy Public Road Go-Kart "Real Life Mario Kart" in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: There is lots of fantastic entertainment here in Akihabara for a new experience. This tour includes following activities: Robot shop: The shop offers many kinds of robots like general walking robots, cardboard box robots, educational robots and some one-of-a-kind robots! You will be able to see some of the most advanced robot technologies here. Maid cafe: I'd like to take you to one of my favourite or the most popular ones. We will enjoy an afternoon tea at this special Japanese cafe. The maid cafes have been running for about 10 years. The maids are super friendly and cute. I am sure you will enjoy your stay there. Anime shops: What else do you associate with Japanese entertainment? Japan is known for its anime and manga culture, of course. The shops I'll take you offers variety of anime stuffs from latest to old ones! One of the tallest buildings that carry anime goods have seven stories! You will definitely find what you have been looking for here. Video game stores: Our last stop will be a good quality video game store which carries incredible amount of games; it has the biggest selection in Akihabara. It does not only have video games but also a lot of hobby goods, music, videos and software related to anime and what-is-called idol. On top of that, the building houses an event space, where the idols have concerts on a regular basis! These stores are covering all the main attractions in Akihabara, and let you get a taste of Japanese entertainment. I'm looking forward to seeing you! Available on all day on weekends and 17:30 and after on weekdays
strTitle: Explore Akihabara to the Fullest

strIntroduction: Tsukiji Fish Market is one of the largest wholesale seafood markets in the world and is the most popular tourist destination among foreign visitors to Japan. The market includes an inner area consisting of over 600 wholesalers and an outer area containing a mixture of retail and wholesale vendors, as well as various sushi restaurants. Because the fish market is exclusive to wholesalers, many Tokyo natives aren't familiar with the sushi restaurants in the area and guidebooks about Tsukiji often provide varying information. In this tour, your guide's intimate knowledge of the market will give you access to information and places that you can't discover from guidebooks. Your tour guide "Tsukiji King" is a professional, English-speaking guide who has been active in the mass media field for his extensive knowledge of the market. Having written many books about the the market and its many restaurants, as well as featured in media programs across Japan, your tour guide will introduce you to delicious culinary experiences in Tsukiji. The tour starts from 9:30 am at Tsukiji Fish Market.
strTitle: Private Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and Dine on Sushi

strIntroduction: If you're interested in Japanese culture, I recommend you to experience a tea ceremony with me! You can enjoy the tea ceremony in a traditional Japanese-style room facing a scenic garden. Please relax and have a wonderful time! This activity is available every day from 10:00 to 16:00. The tea room is located in East Tokyo, near Koiwa or Mizue stations, about 30 minutes by train and city bus from Akihabara Station. You can choose between three types of experiences: 1. Tea ceremony only (60 minutes on average) 2. Kimono experience only (45 minutes on average) 4. Tea ceremony and kimono experience (90-120 minutes in total) The above duration is approximate. The kimono experience will take about 15 minutes for a single visitor and more than 45 minutes for more than 4 people. Guests of all ages and gender can take part. After the experiences, you can enjoy taking photos in both the tea room and the garden. Please take a pleasant walk in the garden as well. At the time of booking, please let me know your preferred date and time. I will contact you back within 24 hours.
strTitle: Experience a tea ceremony in kimono at Bonsai Museum

strIntroduction: Have you always wanted to meet a Geisha, the traditional Japanese entertainer? Do you want to experience something MORE special than just a normal Geisha performance? Here is a chance to have dinner with a Geiko, a top-level geisha! The name “Geiko ”is only given to those who display the highest quality performance out of all the Geishas. This activity will have you meet these high-quality Geishas, where they will dance and serve you at an “enkai” (Japanese name for party). It is very rare to be able to get an opportunity to meet a top-level geisha, even for local Japanese people. Only Voyagin provides this special opportunity to have a dinner with them! Join this experience and take away an unforgettable memory. In this activity you will: • Enjoy a delicious Japanese meal at an established, highly rated Japanese restaurant • Receive drinks and meal service from a beautiful Geiko, one of the best Geishas among all Geishas • Enjoy a traditional and elegant Geisha dance performed by the Geiko. Don’t miss this once-in-a-lifetime experience with a Geiko!
strTitle: Dinner with a Top Level Geisha Performance in Kagurazaka

strIntroduction: Kawaii Monster Cafe in Harajuku, Tokyo, opened in the summer of 2015 under the concept of "swallowing everything around the fashion mecca like a monster" and represents a distinctively new approach to pop-art and dining. The cafe was born as a creation of the widely acclaimed modern art designer Sebastian Masuda who fascinates the world with his peculiar take on "kawaii" (cuteness). Having previously worked on the music videos of the famous J-pop star Kyary Pamyu Pamyu, Sebastian Masuda incorporated his edgy vision of art and fashion into a flashy colourful interior that suits the concept of engulfing the trendiest urban cultures in Tokyo. Visitors enter the Kawaii Monster Cafe through the mouth of a giant monster and find themselves inside a gaudy space of glitter, clashing colours and unique design. Lovers of contemporary pop-art will be thrilled to discover edgy installations such as the cake-shaped merry-go-round, and will continue to explore the different areas of this crazy cafe: - Mushroom Disco, a space in which giant poisonous mushrooms coexist with colourful candies as part of the interior. - Milk Stand, where cute but slightly twisted figures of animals drink from baby milk bottles. - Bar Experiment, the deep sea world surrounded by glowing jellyfish tentacles. - Mel-Tea Room, where ants lead the guests to melting ice cream and sweets. The food and drinks served here complement the wacky interior and guarantee that guests will have an unforgettable dining experience of fashion and art. In addition, Kawaii Monster Cafe is home to five mascot Monster Girls whose visual appearance helps create an atmosphere of a fascinating otherworldliness. They will help the guest find their seat into this labyrinth of colours and shapes, and recommend the best of the artistic menu. A visit to Kaiwaii Monster Cafe is strongly recommended for all visitors to Tokyo who wish to experience something extraordinary while acquainting themselves with the latest trends in Harajuku's urban pop-culture and fashion. Lunch time: 11:30 - 16:30 (last entry until 15:30, 90 minutes stay) Dinner: 18:00 - 22:30 (last order until 22:00). During busy days the lunch time is limited to 90 minutes/dinner to 2 hours. Average Cost - 2,500 yen
strTitle: Reservation for Kawaii Monster Cafe Harajuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this experience, you'll get to participate in Zen zazen (seated meditation) to calm your mind at the temple in Komazawa. By participating zen session, you will improve not only your concentration, but you'll also leave with both your mind and body feeling refreshed. You'll also get to experience sounds that you normally can't hear like the songs of birds. Come join me in practicing zazen!
strTitle: Enjoy Zen meditation Experience in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this experience you'll learn the art of traditional Japanese acupuncture and moxibustion. You'll leave knowing how to rejuvenate both your mind and body! After been the center of Japan's medical practice during the Edo period, acupuncture as a practice died out until being re-evaluated recently. It has the ability to enhance one's immunity by increasing one's body's resistance to diseases. In addition, moxibustion also detoxes the body and has anti-aging effects. Many people who have undergone moxibustion are able to retain their young, beautiful skin and continue to get treatment often. There was a moxibustion scene in The Last Samurai and even Steve Jobs got a moxibustion treatment! In this experience, I'll explain the procedure so that you can easily replicate it at home. This can either be done at your house or hotel. Your experience will consist of: - A lecture about Japanese traditional medicine - Learning the basic-approach of the shiatsu massage (which stimulates the tsubo - or pressure points - of one's body) - Learning about moxibustion (treatment stimulated by burning traditional healing herbs on your skin) Learn and master acupuncture and moxibustion with me. Let's start anti-aging!
strTitle: Learn Traditional Japanese Acupuncture

strIntroduction: Wearing traditional costumes, such as kimono or yukata, while strolling historical and picturesque streets has become a trend when sightseeing in Kyoto. It is an authentic cultural experience that will unexpectedly leave you with many beautiful photos and memories not easily forgotten. Yumeyakata is one of the biggest kimono rental shops in Kyoto. We provide kimonos for rent not only for ladies but also for men and children so that the whole family can enjoy the experience together. We can provide all the items you need to wear kimono, so just bring yourself! This kimono rental package includes the kimono itself, the sash belt (obi), the Japanese clutch, the Japanese sandals, and the Japanese socks. Don't you worry about your hair styling, because we will do your hair, just for 1500 JPY. The hair styling will be done by our professional hair stylist, with the high speed. Still worry about the hair accessories? We also provide it for sale, and the price start from 900 JPY. Wear our kimono and make a lot of beautiful memories in Kyoto.
strTitle: Book a Kimono Rental Hana Plan in Kyoto

strIntroduction: A "Brand New Entertainment Show" will start in Tokyo this year! This is the musical "SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX", which is a new fusion of "traditional Japanese culture and Anime"! Spectators can also participate in making the stage, so it is sure to be an unforgettable memory of your stay in Tokyo! There will be synchronization of Japanese dancing (Kabuki and Nihon Buyo) and street dance, Japanese traditional musical instruments playing rock, and projection mapping on stage. Please enjoy the battle scenes of Samurai and Ninja coordinated with enticing music and projection mapping. 〈Show start time〉19:00 or 20:30 *There will be only one show per day. *The musical is 70 minutes long. Opening time depends on the day you watch the musical, so please make sure to check before coming to the theater. "SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX" starts comparatively late at night so you will have plenty of time to explore the city of Tokyo and even enjoy dinner before the curtain rises. 〈Download the free app "SAKURA -JAPAN IN THE BOX"- 〉 • Subtitles online! No need to worry about the language barrier. If you download the app for SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX, you will be able to read the subtitles (English or Chinese) on your smartphone in real time as the show proceeds! • Use the app during the show! What's really cool about this app is that you can sync your phone with the show as it starts. The app will show you the lyrics of the songs as the performers sing them on stage. Also, you can take photos with the special filters made just for the show, "SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX". 〈Share your experience on SNS!〉 Feel free to take pictures of this stunning musical and share them on SNS (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and any social media you like!). Normally taking pictures of plays and musicals in Japan is strictly prohibited, so this is a rare chance to take as many photos as you want and show them off to those who missed the show! 〈Schedule Options〉 It can be booked up to 18:00 on the day of performance. 〈Tickets for SAKURA〉 SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX will run from September 7th, 2016 to March 31st, 2017 - please check the calendar! *Schedule for December 2016 - March 2017 will be updated soon. *No change will be allowed after purchasing the ticket 〈Last minute discounted tickets for SAKURA〉 Last minute tickets (tickets purchased 1-7 days prior to the show date) will be discounted. *No change will be allowed after purchasing the ticket
strTitle: New Stage Show "SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX" at Tokyo Meijiza

strIntroduction: Enjoy wearing Japanese Yukata (casual summer kimono) in the center of Tokyo! Yukata is a light-weight garment, somewhat simple compared to a kimono, and men and women wear them in the present day when going to see fireworks or festivals in the summer. It is usually made of cotton or synthetic fabric and is unlined. At the venue, choose your Yukata out of a variety of choices and our staff will help you get dressed in them. Then, enjoy taking pictures with your phone or camera. Options: ・15 minute rental ・2 hour rental With this plan, you will have enough time to visit the famous Meiji Shrine, and stroll around in Harajuku. Yukatas are also available for purchase in the Harajuku Tourist Information Center.
strTitle: Wear a Yukata in Harajuku!

strIntroduction: Sumo is Japan's national sport! The Grand Tournament runs just 6 times a year, but the rest of the year there are many chances to see sumo wrestlers in action by watching them up-close-and-personal at a morning training session. Join our professional guides and be escorted to the sumo stable, learn about the history and how it's entwined with Japan's native Shinto religion, and see these impressive athletes at their rigorous training. After the practice finishes, you'll have the exclusive opportunity to take photos with the sumo wrestlers! Training takes place in Tokyo, Osaka, and Nagoya according to the season. For Osaka, please see our other tour page here: http://voyag.in/sumo-morning-practice-osaka Please keep in mind the following precautions and rules when you visit the sumo stables: 1. A sumo stable is not a tourist facility. Sumo wrestlers practice very seriously every day, so please don't forget to show respect to the stable master and wrestlers. 2. Please watch the practice quietly and do not move around in the stable. Children under 12 years of age are not permitted. Sumo fans are expected to be as still as possible during the practice. Depending on the tour date and sumo beya, well-behaved children under 12 years of age may be permitted to participate in the tour so please inquire with us before booking. 3. Please do not talk in the stable. Even your whispering voice may disturb the wrestlers. 4. Please do not stand on the ring or on the sandy ground. The ring is the sacred place for the wrestlers. 5. At the entrance of the stable, please take off your shoes before stepping onto the tatami floor. When you sit on the tatami floor, please cross your legs. Do not stretch your legs toward the ring as it is considered impolite to show the soles of feet to the wrestlers. 6. Please take off your hat and sunglasses inside the stable. 7. While inside the stable, you are not allowed to eat, drink, or smoke. 8. Cameras: If you ask for permission first, you will usually be permitted to take photos during the practice, but please never use a flash, loud shutter sounds, or take videos during the practice. 9. Please turn off your mobile phone. 10. Once you start watching the practice, you are supposed to stay until the wrestlers finish their practice. So please try not to leave the stable during the practice. 11. Please don't bring a big backpack or luggage with you since the sumo stable has limited space for the audience. 12. If you have any visible tattoos, please cover them as much as possible. Tattoos are not widely accepted in Japanese society and particularly in traditional spaces such as the sumo stables. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For 2016 the preliminary schedule in Tokyo is as follows: January 4th - 23rd (except for January 8th) February 2nd - 23rd April 5th - 30th (except for April 25th) May 1st - 25th and 31st (except for 5th to 7th) June 1st - 22nd August 1st - 31st (except for 25th to 29th) September 1st - 24th (except for 8th to 10th) October 4th - 26th December 6th - 21st Other dates are off-season for Sumo wrestlers with no official training sessions, so this tour will not be available. Instead, you can book tickets for the national Sumo tournaments held in the months when this tour is not available. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS ※ - The tour starting time can range between 7:30-9:30am. - The sumo stable may be located in Tokyo, Kawasaki, Saitama, Chiba, or Ibaraki. The location is dependent on the sumo wrestlers' schedule. - The meeting point will be at the station nearest to the scheduled stable. The meeting time and meeting point depend on the sumo wrestlers' training schedule, which can only be confirmed when the date is close, since the wrestlers may change their training schedule according to their needs. - Children under the age of 12 and elderly people over the age of 60 will not be admitted inside the sumo stable as guests are required to sit still for most part of the practice session on the tatami floor. The sumo stable has the right to refuse access to guests who are unable to observe the house manners. - During busy periods this may be a large group tour (1~4 groups). - For large bookings, your group may be separated into 2 different stables. - It is very rare but in the case that the sumo wrestlers are unwell and other unforeseen circumstances, the practice and tour may be shortened. - There are no restrooms available at the sumo stable. - For the photo opportunity with the sumo wrestlers, you must stay for the entire duration of the practice. Photographs with the wrestlers will only be allowed after the entire practice finishes. Please place your booking if you agree with the above conditions.
strTitle: Watch Sumo Wrestlers during their Morning Practice in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Rent go-karts and enjoy driving them on the public road starting off from Tokyo's Otaku paradise, Akihabara! This kart rental shop in Akihabara is the first go-kart rental shop for driving on the public road. It is good to use as you go sightseeing because you can see Tokyo from different places. People rent karts for events, advertisements and for many other purposes. You can enjoy the go-karts privately or with a group and enjoy cosplay while driving. Many people wear the Mario costume and enjoy Mario Kart on the public road! There's no doubt that you will stand out in such vivid, unique kart! Why we love it: - You can drive on the public road without a seat belt or helmet. - The kart's maximum speed is 60km/h! - You can go outside Akihabara if you return in time! - Some people drove all the way to Nagoya to establish the record. - People who are planning to purchase the kart, Youtubers who are filming videos, birthday for the kids, etc. many kinds of people rent go-karts! You can rent a go-kart from 1 hour to up to 5 hours. Business hours: 10 am - 8 pm Note that the go-kart activity will not be available after 8 pm, therefore book earlier if you want to enjoy your entire requested time. For example, if you want to book a 2-hour tour, the latest possible time for booking will be 6 pm. After they give you a lecture, you can go for a drive! Please note that: ※ You must have a valid Japanese drivers license, Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit based on the 1949 Geneva Convention*. ※ Bring a valid Japanese drivers license, Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit* and a copy of your passport (passport is not required for Japanese) to the shop on the day. ※ All karts are for 1-person. There are no multi-person karts. ※ You have to fill the tank up before you return the kart when you choose the 2, 3, or 5 hour course. ※ We don't recommend you park the kart anywhere because there are not many parking lots in Tokyo, and we can't take any responsibility if any accidents happen to the kart. ※ The facility has costumes that you can borrow for no charge. However, you can buy some inexpensive costumes at the nearby Don Quixote shop if you would like your own! ※ You can book an optional add-on for a driver to guide you throughout Akihabara. The driver will drive in a separate kart. ※ The height restriction: must be 150cm to 185cm. ※ Preferred 100 kg and less. Over 100kg: the kart won’t move as fast ※ The activity is cancelled only when it rains heavily. When the activity is cancelled due to bad weather, you will be able to re-schedule without charge. If the alternative date for re-scheduling due to bad weather is not available, you will get a full refund. ※Pregnant Drivers: It is possible for pregnant drivers to take part in this experience but the go-kart handle may hit the guest's tummy and it may be uncomfortable. It is possible to make a booking first and go to shop try to see if she can fit comfortably in the kart. If the pregnant guest cannot fit, a refund will be provided for the pregnant guest. ※ You will need to buy "Flexible date/time change" option when you re-schedule the date for your own reasons. ※ The insurance fee is included in the price. Third Party Liability = Unlimited Guest himself/herself = up to JPY 30,000,000 Disclaimer = JPY 50,000 *Holders of a license from Belgium, France, Germany, Monaco, Slovenia, Switzerland or Taiwan can use an official Japanese translation provided by the Japan Automobile Federation (JAF) or the country’s embassy or consulate in Japan. We will promise you to make your trip unforgettable! Don't miss this chance!
strTitle: Rent Go-Karts and ride around Akihabara!

strIntroduction: This is a shuttle service between Yokohama Port and Tokyo. While enjoying a relaxing holiday on a cruise, the least thing you wanna do when you disembark at Yokohama port is to find out what train route to take or get lost in Japan's complicated railway system. Make the most out of your time and money and book a shuttle service to take you to Tokyo and back to Yokohama Port. When you arrive at the pick-up place, you will see the driver waiting for you with a sign. He will carry your luggage, and lead you to a spacious van, where you can relax and enjoy your shuttle service to your destination in central Tokyo. Service Available Dates in 2016: April.25th, 30th June.15th, 24th July.3rd, 8th, 17th, 25th August.4th, 15th, 24th, 31st September.9th, 17th, 25th October.4th, 9th [IMPORTANT] ※You can not decide pick up time. Host will decide. ※Shared shuttle service is not available for guests staying at hostel, private residence or capsule hotels. ※Shared shuttle service price is per person
strTitle: Enjoy Shuttle service between Yokohama Port and Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tsukiji Market is the biggest and most famous seafood market in the world. Tsukiji Market is basically divided into 2 areas - the Inside and the Outside market. The Inside market is mainly for professionals (such as chefs and wholesalers), while the outside market is mainly for consumers. We will explore the whole market (both Inside and Outside market) with an English-speaking guide. The detailed itinerary is below: 9:00 am - Meet at the Main entrance of Tsukiji market 9:10 am - Visit Namiyoke shrine and the Outside Market 10:00 am - Explore the Inside Fish Market 10:45 am - Fruits and vegetable market 11:00 am - End of the tour
strTitle: Visit Tokyo's Tsukiji Market on a Private Tour

strIntroduction: Hello, we are a new Japanese cooking class with friendly and knowledgeable local staff here to teach you all about Japanese cooking in Kyoto. Our cooking studio is located in a traditional townhouse which is nicely refurbished, so that you can enjoy a balance of both modern and traditional atmosphere. Learn how to make 4-5 dishes, as well as experience sake and tea tastings. By the end of the class, you will be an expert at authentic Japanese home cooked recipes, and have made new Japanese friends! Morning class: 9:30-13:00 Menu: sushi roll, tempura, egg roll, miso soup, salad and another side dish Afternoon class: 14:00-17:30 Menu: Japanese home cooking class, 5 dishes including salad, rice dish, fish or meat dish, and soup You will get to enjoy the delicious food you cooked at the end of the class.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Cooking Class with Friendly Locals in Kyoto

strIntroduction: This new style of Japanese entertainment has taken Roppongi by storm! Oiran (traditional Japanese courtesans), samurai and geisha dance across the kaleidoscopic rotating stage in a series of beautiful, exciting Japanese-style performances. The cast of 11 professional dancers and drag queens will bring the sensuality of Tokyo's old "pleasure quarters" to life during this exciting 50 minute show. Enjoy drinks in the expansive premises and prepare yourself for a night of fun antics. Take advantage of our convenient "all-you-can drink-plan", while watching the performers fly overhead. ■Performance Date Everyday (except New Year's Holiday) ■Show Schedule *1st Show (Show time 50 min) Open 18:00 - Show starts 19:30 - Close 20:40 *2nd Show (Show time 50 min) Open 21:00 - Show start 22:00 - Close 23:30 Duration: 2.5 hour(s) Pick-up: Not available ※Please note this price is inclusive of the 10% discount offer. Included in the price: Show fee / All-You-Can-Drink Plan (includes beer, shochu, whiskey, apricot liqueur, orange juice and oolong tea) / Snacks Meals are available throughout the show for an extra charge. Starting from March 1st 2016, non-smoking hours are until 21:00. Please do not arrive before the check-in time, as you will not be able to enter the theater. Closest Train Station: ・Oedo Line or Hibiya Line's Roppongi Station (Exit 3 or 5)
strTitle: 10% OFF Oiran-Za Traditional Japanese New Cabaret Show

strIntroduction: Explore 3 places in 3 hours! Experience Tokyo’s bustling culinary underbelly on this 3-hour food tour in three very famous and must see places in Tokyo! This is a walking and eating food tour where you can try 5 kinds of Yakitori with 2 complimentary drinks, 6-8 local dishes and Japanese Wagashi (Japanese Dessert)! Starting off in Yurakucho and ending in Shimbashi your guide will show you the sights, sounds and most importantly, tastes of Tokyo most tourists do not get to experience. We will visit Gado Shita ,a lively restaurant district built up under the brick arches beneath the elevated train tracks. Step into the narrow streets of the red lanterns and neon signs, so called yokocho alleys, where you can find yourself back in the 70s of Japan. In such exotic and retro ambience of the Showa period times, you'll see local izakayas mostly frequented by locals. You'll enjoy 5 scrumptious yakitoris and 2 drinks in the first restaurant. Continuing in Ginza, we'll show you some very interesting food spots where you can find a 500 USD melon, some traditionally and beautifully arranged desserts and see the famous landmarks of Tokyo's most expensive real estate area! See how the new glamorous clashes with the rustic old once we set foot in Shimbashi, home to some of the most authentic local eateries and izakayas in Tokyo. Get the chance dine with locals and sample 6-8 dishes you'll surely never forget! This is a food tour you MUST try when visiting Tokyo! The tour is from 5:00PM to 8:00PM.
strTitle: Tokyo Walking Food Tour at Night

strIntroduction: How would you like to fly through the night sky of Tokyo in your very own private helicopter? Tokyo has one of the most beautiful night views in the world, with many landmarks that you will find during your flight. Spot the Tokyo Tower, Skytree, the ferris wheel at Odaiba, and the Rainbow Bridge all lit up in beautiful colors. This ride is completely private, and is perfect for romantic dates. Take your precious partner for a flight, and it will be the most memorable moment during your stay in Tokyo. You can select the normal course or the prestige course. For the normal course,the course is Odaiba, Rainbow Bridge, Ginza, and Tokyo station. For the prestige course, the course is Odaiba, Rainbow Bridge, Tokyo Tower, Roppongi, Shibuya, Shinjuku, Tokyo Done, Ueno, Asakusa, and Tokyo station. ※The last departure time for Night Cruising: 20:00 (Meeting Time: 19:40) ※The last departure time for Prestige Course: 19:50 (Meeting Time: 19:30)
strTitle: Helicopter Night Cruising in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Asakusa is one of the oldest towns in Tokyo and has flourished since the founding of Sensoji Temple in 628 AD. The temple is located at the center of the town and is surrounded by many traditional downtown streets and areas. Our rickshaws mainly travel around the surrounding downtown areas, and we introduce guests to the history of the town, buildings, shops, and restaurants, as well as to other fun facts. Our drivers will take many photos of you along the way so be sure to bring your camera! History of rickshaws: Now rickshaws are used for sightseeing, but originally they were the main form of transportation in Japan. Invented in Tokyo over 150 years ago, rickshaws are still used in many parts of the world for transportation. Ebisuya rickshaws are all handmade and mostly come from the Hida-Takayama area in Gifu prefecture. The design has changed little from their original invention, and riding on our gorgeous red seats, you can still feel the same wind in your hair as those who rode rickshaws 150 years ago. About our drivers: Enjoy your rickshaw ride in style and comfort with our professionally-trained drivers, called “shafu” in Japanese. Each “shafu” goes through an extensive training program focused on safety, hospitality, and of course the history and culture of the town and Japan. At first sight a rickshaw may look just like a hand-pulled taxi but our service is really about making memories. There is no better way to get to know a town or move around in comfort. We can learn fun facts about the history of each town and see the ins and outs of small streets for an amazing experience. We look forward to meeting you and joining us for not only sight ”seeing” but also sight "feeling"! 30 minutes course This is the high light course of the down town area of Asakusa. The tour goes seeing around the temple such as “Rokku” old entertainment area with some Izakaya-Bar street, and shopping area for some traditional crafts or many Kimono shopps etc. We can come back to the departure point or drop-off at the temple is also available. 60 minutes This is very popular course seeing around most of the recommendable places from busy places such as “Rokku” and Hanayashiki amusement park, to the quiet places like Geisha area or Matsuchiyama, the oldest temple in this area. 90 minutes In this course you can see those places written above, plus you can practice a pray in the famous shrine for happy encounters with the Gods of happy fortune cats. On the way back you can enjoy a great view of Tokyo Sky Tree at the riverside of Sumidagawa. 120 minutes If you would like to complete all attractions of this town, no doubt choosing this course will leave you fully satisfied with Asakusa town tour. About this tour: - The tour is available even on rainy days (except during typhoons, earthquakes, etc). The rickshaws will be covered to protect you from the rain. - A maximum of 2 adults per rickshaw. Up to 2 children, 6 years old and under, can ride with 2 adults (children have to ride on the adult's lap). - Adult pricing applies to visitors ages 7 years old and older. - Wheelchair and stroller-friendly rickshaws are available. - This tour can be customized depending on your interests. - You can enjoy the tour anytime between 9:30am to 5:30pm on the day of reservation. Please let us know your preferred starting time with a message when you book. - The tours will run until 6:00pm between May to August. - You can choose between 30-minute, 60-minute, 90-minute, and 120-minute tours.
strTitle: Enjoy a historical rickshaw tour in Asakusa with Ebisuya!

strIntroduction: In Japan, the affectionate, respectful and amusing Akita dog is best known by the true story of Hachiko in the 1920s. Hachiko's owner, a professor, returned from work each day at 3 pm, and his devoted dog met him daily at the train station in Shibuya, Tokyo. Then one day, the professor dies unexpectedly. Loyal Hachiko continued to wait around for 9 years at the station for his master. Richard Gere stars in Hollywood's version of the story, "Hachi: A Dog's Tale." A male Akita dog that awaits you at the diner is 12 year-old Hayate. He is one of the proud Akita dogs from the best reputable breeder, Shirai. In his youth, he won many awards at competitions, starred on TV and in magazines. He even became a model for Hachi books. Hayate's father Kasuga went abroad to France 11 years ago and became a favorite dog of the French top breeder, needless to say there must be many step brothers and sisters of Hayate in Europe. Hayate is currently helping his beloved owner Mickey as a co-host of the diner & bar. Repeating customers say that there is some spiritual significance attached to Hayate and that they can have therapeutic experience at this place. Here you can enjoy a light meal which includes a Japanese beef hamburger patty, a salad, soup and rice, or a casual green tea time with Japanese traditional confectionery. As a bonus, you can wear a Japanese yukata (light kimono) and have photos of you taken by the staff. This activity is available every day for 1.5-hour visits.
strTitle: Dine or Drink with the Affectionate Akita Dog in Tokyo

strIntroduction: If you are planning to visit Kyoto, join us to get in touch with real Japanese traditional culture! We will teach you how to play a song named “Sakura” with Koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) at a 110 years old traditional house, Soushunan. You will experience a 60-minute long lesson and Koto play under the guidance of a professional Koto lecturer. And you will get to take the musical score home with you after the lesson. We will make preparations for the lesson, so you don't need to bring anything.
strTitle: Take a Koto Lesson at a Traditional House in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Would you like to have a Lunch with the founder of Voyagin? If you do, I would love to have a lunch with you! I've traveled to more than 30 countries and hosted a lot of tourists for 3 years in Japan. I started my own business in 2011, so I can offer you not just traveling tips, but also recount the story of start-ups in Japan. In this activity, - You can have his recommended food - You will get travel tips in Tokyo - You will get to know about Japanese start-ups Looking forward to seeing you! I love to make and talk to new friends! ※日本人の方で調査目的、勉強目的の場合は質問するだけでなく、面会での議論が等価交換になるよう、なんらか僕らのためになる情報、提案を持ってご連絡ください。
strTitle: Lunch with the Voyagin Founder and Staff

strIntroduction: Tokyo has thousands of good locations for photo shootings. Based on your planning of the visit of the city, we can decide where to take photos. I support photo shootings for any occasions. If you have any special day while you visit Tokyo, I will be able to help you capturing the wonderful memory. (Please inform me the details in advance.) Equipments: Nikon Professional Cameras Delivery: Within 7 days via online storage
strTitle: Hire Your Personal Photographer in Tokyo
