strIntroduction: This tour is perfect for those who naturally rise in the early morning, or for those who just want to have a unique experience and don't mind getting up early for it. We start at the world famous Fushimi Inari Shrine and what a special time to see this amazing place. There are thousands of red gates which line the path up the hillside. With the low early light casting long shadows here we can get some truly fantastic photos before all the crowds arrive. From there we will visit Kiyomizu Temple, one of the oldest temples in Kyoto and a true gem. This is the most popular temple in Kyoto or maybe even Japan so it is a real treat to get there before the crowds and get a spectacular view of the city below. After that we make our way to Arashiyama by train and get to see the beautiful bamboo grove which if we are lucky will still be relatively quiet and great for getting some fantastic photos or just to stop and listen to the soundscape of the branches swaying in the wind. Before leaving Arashiyama, we make a visit to one of the most beautiful zen temples in Kyoto, Tenryuji Temple a world heritage site with a radiant garden. A view that you will surely cherish for years to come. Along the way we give you insights about Buddhism, Japanese garden design, history and more. We are also happy to help you with any questions you have about Kyoto or Japan and can even help you plan your days ahead.
strTitle: See the morning freshness of Kyoto in an early bird tour

strIntroduction: Are you familiar with traditional Japanese outfits? Kimonos? Because kimonos in Japan are adorned with delicate decorations, they are really beautiful. Commonly they’re worn for celebrations such as New Year, but in this activity you can casually dress up in kimono and walk around the old streets of the traditional Tokyo neighbourhood Asakusa. In this activity, you’ll… ・Receive professional help from the host when dressing up in the kimono. You'll have the chance to learn about the various kimono items and the proper ways to put the outfit on. ・Take a walk in Asakusa dressed in a kimono. This will be a great opportunity to take a walk, shop, and dine with a veteran English-speaking tour guide around the symbols of Asakusa such as the Sensoji temple, and the Nakamise street famous as the paradise of Japanese souvenirs and sweets. Note: The best time to start this activity is in the morning, around 9:00-10:00 am, as Asakusa gets busier and more crowded later in the day. ・Have a professional cameraman take pictures for you during your walk. You can create wonderful memories from your trip to Tokyo. ・Take back, on request, a CD-R filled with the pictures of you in your kimono. It is highly recommended that you book the add-on option and take a CD-R with many professional photos of you dressed in kimono. Walking in Asakusa is an excellent chance to experience a glimpse of traditional Japanese culture. When you take a walk around the old neighbourhood, why not do it dressed up in a traditional kimono? It’ll be a fantastic experience and an unforgettable memory! *Although all times are available for booking, we highly recommend that you request starting from 9:00am or 10:00am. The streets of Asakusa can get too crowded in the afternoon for nice pictures.
strTitle: Walk the Streets of Asakusa in a Kimono

strIntroduction: We coordinate local volunteers to accompany you at the meal table to assist you with choosing your meal. We will translate menus, give you suggestions and introduce you to the real Japanese way of ordering food and drinks at a izakaya. We'll have some drinks and nice food, and enjoy a fun chat! Please let us know your preferable date/time and place! We will then connect you and local volunteers, and he/she will pick you up at your hotel or a famous landmark, and take you to the Izakaya.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Dishes with Locals at an Izakaya in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Tired of typical touristic style of travel? Like to feel local vibes? This tour will show you several good-quality inspirational spots where local creative class people gather. Following a meet-up either at your hotel or in the area of visit, we will go to Daikanyama T-site to see a great selection of books, magazine, music, stationary and movies. After getting some initial inspiration, you will experience Japanese original coffee style "Kissaten" at Sarugaku Coffee, a hidden coffee shop once ranked as #1 coffee spot in Tokyo. Then, you will have art experience at the Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo where you can see some edgy exhibitions. Have another coffee break at one of the representative of third-wave coffee movement in Tokyo. This time have a quality coffee in a traditional Japanese house. Finally, wrap up your day with hip restaurants and bars in Ebisu or Nakameguro. Please note that there are alternatives for each spots. If you would like to visit, for example, a different coffee shop, I can guide you to another place. Feel free to consult me about customizing this tour.
strTitle: Explore Tokyo's Creative Spots guided by a Creative Director

strIntroduction: You can enjoy Japanese calligraphy experience. We will give you a small lecture on how to use calligraphy tools and how to write Japanese words with those tools. Your Calligraphy lesson will be in a traditional Japanese tatami room where you can enjoy the view of a Japanese garden. After you complete it, you can take it home in a frame. It will be a memorable souvenir for you. Lesson Contents: 10 minutes : Explanation about calligraphy 60 minutes : Calligraphy Lesson 10 minutes : Tea break
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Calligraphy Experience in Nara

strIntroduction: This is a shuttle service between Haneda international airport and Tokyo. After a long flight into Haneda Airport, the least thing you wanna do is find out what train route to take or get lost in Japan's complicated railway system. Make the most out of your time and money and book a shared or private shuttle service to take you to Tokyo and back to Haneda Airport! When you arrive at the pick-up place, you will see the driver waiting for you with your name written on a sign. He will carry your luggage, and lead you to a spacious van, where you can relax and enjoy your shuttle service to your destination in central Tokyo. ※Service from Haneda Airport is available for guests arriving at Haneda Airport between 21:00 to 06:00. ※Service to Haneda Airport is available for guests departing at Haneda Airport between 22:00 to 07:00. (Hotel Pick Up time will be between 19:00 to 04:00) Tokyo 15 wards: Arakawa-ku, Bunkyo-ku, Chiyoda-ku, Chuo-ku, Edogawa-ku, Koto-ku, Meguro-ku, Minato-ku, Ota-ku, Shibuya-ku, Shinagawa-ku, Shinjuku-ku, Sumida-ku, Taito-ku, Toshima-ku [IMPORTANT] ※You can not decide pick up time. Host will decide. ※Shared shuttle service is not available for guests staying at hostel, private residence or capsule hotels. ※Shared shuttle service price is per person ※Private shuttle service price is per group (up to 4 participants or 8 participants)
strTitle: Enjoy Shuttle service between Haneda Airport/Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a customized tour, and I can take you around anywhere within Nagoya. If you don't know much about the area, below is a model course that I usually do, so please take a look! Any suggestions or requests are welcome. Example 3-4 hour itinerary 1. Start with a pick-up at your hotel, or meet up at your desired location. 2. Nagoya castle - Explanation about the historical importance of the castle, indicating how Nagoya has developed and how important the location has been to the development of Japan 3. Oosu Kanon Temple - You can visit this famous temple, known for its long history. Afterwards we can go shopping at the local shopping areas along the street surrounding the temple. You can find Japanese local souvenirs, sweets, some delicious Nagoya street food; some of which are only available here. - Examples of famous local foods include Uirou (sweet rice jelly) and rice crackers. In this tour, you will: ● Be exposed to Japanese culture in an in-depth way with the aid of a guide. ● Stroll around preserved traditional Japanese streets. ● Enjoy shopping at local Japanese stores . ● Feel relaxed at Japanese trendy coffee shops. Please feel free to ask me about other places to visit in Nagoya! I look forward to showing you around.
strTitle: 50% OFF Customized Nagoya Tour with a Local Guide

strIntroduction: Hi, I'm Tamao! I will read your past, current and future from either palm reading, runestones, tarot cards or from angel cards. I will tell you the results based on Japanese and white magic at the end of the reading. White magic is a type of magic that brings you happiness and luck without any sacrifice or pain for anyone else. It is a very unselfish type of magic so please don't worry! If you have received unexpected fortune telling results in the past, or feel you are surrounded by bad luck, please don't worry. I will guide you through a journey that will bring luck and upgrade your fortune even if you are already lucky! I can give you detailed reading results as you present me with more detailed information about yourself. Please consult with me on what topics you would like to talk about, such as on your life, health, job and love life. I usually give my readings in Akebonobashi, 2 stops from Shinjuku, but if you wish I can go to your hotel in Tokyo to do the fortune telling. Please choose from either the 40 minutes or 80 minutes fortune telling plan and select your transportation option (if you wish me to go to your hotel) when you make the reservation.
strTitle: Experience Fortune Telling in Shinjuku

strIntroduction: Yabusame, one of the most divine martial arts in Japan, consists of shooting arrows at different targets while riding a running horse. It is a traditional ritual designed to please the gods of fertility, and it has been handed down as a cultural tradition for about one thousand years. Learn Yabusame in this activity held in Ibaraki, about 2 hours from downtown Tokyo and great for a day trip! The professional instructors of our famous riding club will teach you all the basics. During the first hour, basic archery like using a bow and arrow is taught. Afterwards, you intensify what you practiced on the ground in the previous hour, riding on a horse! Yabusame will take you back to a former period of Japan! It will be an unique and energetic experience. Please note: Guide interpreters are required for non-Japanese speakers. It is not easy for inexperienced people to learn Yabusame. Complete beginners will begin with horseback riding practice. When they are ready, they will progress to archery practice. Please listen carefully and do as our instructors tell you as you might get injured or hurt someone else. ※The activity is held after 15:00.
strTitle: Japanese Traditional Mounted Archery Yabusame

strIntroduction: You'll meet your professional tour guide bright and early at 1:00 am to reserve your limited spot to the renown Tuna Auction. After you will witness first hand the early morning brokers check deep inside the famous tuna using flashlights, as they assess the quality of the fish. Then you will watch as exorbitant prices are paid for the high-quality tuna during the Tuna Auction from 5:30 am and 6:00 am. It's a rare and exciting opportunity to experience the the Tuna Auction live. Following the Tuna Auction, the expert guide will give you a short market tour in a small, exclusive group. In the short market tour, you will learn more history about the Tsukiji fish market and explore the vegetable market and the outside of the inside market. If you are lucky, you can watch the vegetable auction! You will also enjoy browsing various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, and dried seafood in the outer market. If you are craving some of the freshest sushi available in the world, you can finish the morning with a sushi breakfast, at your request. Please let the guide know in advance if you would like to be taken to a recommended sushi restaurant. Please note, the breakfast fee is not included in the tour price. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Add-On: Extended tour of the Tsukiji fish market If you would like to have a full tour of the Tsukiji fish market after your Tuna Auction Tour, you can add-on an extended walking tour! You can do so by purchasing the Add-on option along with your Tuna Auction Tour. Between the end of Tuna Auction Tour (around 5:30 am) and Tsukiji Fish Market opening time (9:00 am), the following is an example itinerary: - Breakfast at a sushi restaurant in Tsukiji market: The guide will bring you to one of their recommended restaurants for a fresh seafood breakfast (1 hour) - Tour the Outer Market: Browse various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, nori (dried seaweed), and dried seafood (1 hour) - Namiyoke Inari Shrine: Visit the Shinto shrine that translates to "protection of waves" that is meant to protect the Tsukiji Market. Then enjoy a relaxing coffee break before starting the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour (1 hour) The duration of the Tuna auction and market add on tour is approximately 10 hours, from 1:00 am until 11:00 am. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Please note that if your booking is for more than 5 people, you might be split into groups to meet the safety guidelines set by the market authorities. The Tuna Auction Tour is regularly available Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, excluding holidays and market closed days. Our tour guide will ensure you have access into the exclusive Tuna Auction, but remember you'll be 1 of 120 other visitors in waiting room and 60 of you will attend each of the 2 bustling auctions!
strTitle: Tsukiji Tuna Auction Tour with a Guide during the night

strIntroduction: Special Announcement!! Voyagin offers the tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers and free pick up service from following area. Be sure to reach at least 5 minutes prior to departure time. Area 1 : Tokyo station, Ginza, Hibiya, Shinbashi, Shiodome Depart at 07:25am / Imperial Hotel Tokyo Area 2: Akasaka, Roppongi Depart at 07:35am / ANA Intercontinental hotel Akasaka Area 3: Chiyoda ward Depart at 07:50am / Hotel New Otani In this 1-day bus tour, you can not only explore fascinating Mt.Fuji, the UNESCO World Heritage, but also visit Lake Kawaguchi and Oshino Ninja Village, which makes your travel in Japan more enjoyable and unforgettable! Don' miss this chance to see the jaw-dropping scenery of Mt.Fuji. Lake Kawaguchi is one of Fuji Goko (Five Fuji Lakes) and famous for the best view of Mt. Fuji in this area and is a splendid and breathtaking scene. Oshino Hakkai consists of eight ponds filled by the underground spring water from Mt. Fuji. The area is well worth exploring due to its beauty and nature. While there you can't miss Oshino Shinobi no Sato (Oshino Ninja Village), a Ninja theme park that was opened in 2015. There, you will be able to appreciate a Japanese traditional garden in addition to experiencing several activities in Ninja style and enjoy delicious Japanese food with local ingredients. The highlight of the tour is visiting Mt. Fuji's 5th Station! Depending on the weather conditions, the scenery is spectacular!! The time you spend here will undoubtedly be a special memory. The excitement of the tour continues with a 4D movie at Fuji-Q Highland which simulates an airplane flying over Mt. Fuji. After the bus tour is over, there will be enough time for you to enjoy the rest of the evening in Tokyo. --Brief itinerary-- 8:20 Depart from the meeting point in Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower) 10:00-10:30 Lake Kawaguchi Enjoy the natural reflecting pool for Mt. Fuji! 11:05-11:45 Oshino Hakkai (Oshino Eight Ponds) See the beautiful ponds with the view of Mt.Fuji! 11:50-13:00 Oshino Shinobi no Sato (Oshino Ninja Village) Explore traditional Japanese culture and take photos with Ninja! 13:45-14:15 Mt. Fuji 5th Station Get the closest view of Mt.Fuji and take photos that you can show it off to your friends! 14:55-15:40 4D experience at Fuji-Q Highland This will definitely be one of the most astonishing experience in this tour! 17:00-17:30 End of the tour at Shinjuku Station south exit --Notices-- ・The tour is operated daily from March 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016. (Except Apr 29 - May 1, May 3 - 5, May 7, Jul 16, Aug 6, Aug 11 - 14, Sep 3, Sep 17 - 18, Sep 22 - 24, Oct 8, Dec 23) ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・There is a tour in English and Japanese. ・There is multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese and Thai available. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If any place is closed, we will try to replace it with an alternative place. ・If we are not able to go to Mt. Fuji 5th Station due to the weather, we will attend the highest point on road there.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus Tour to Mt.Fuji & Meet Ninja from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: There are lots of unique cafes in Tokyo: maid cafe, cat cafe, and Gyaru cafe are the most well known ones. But there is another cafe that will really get your attention: Owl Cafe! An Owl Cafe is a space where you can relax and interact with owls. You can not only touch them but also take pictures with them. Please follow the rules of the cafe and bear in mind that the owls are sensitive animals. Most owl cafes require you to queue up, perhaps for hours on end, in order to experience this "healing entertainment". So, if you'd like to step outside the bustle of Tokyo life and try a uniquely therapeutic experience but don't have hours to throw away, our Japanese concierge team will be happy to make an advance reservation for you at an owl cafe in Central Tokyo. After you make a booking with us we will apply at the cafe for 3 reservation times, and a few days before the requested date will get the result of your application and let you know the exact time and place. Owl cafe takes reservations at the following time slots: 11:00-12:00/ 12:00-13:00/13:00-14:00/14:00-15:00/15:00-16:00/16:00-17:00/17:00-18:00 Available every day for 1-hour visits. Grab a seat, choose a drink, pet an owl! Disclaimer: Please note that there might be also other birds depending on the available cafe (such as parrots, hawks, etc). Consumption and play time with the birds is charged separately. The exact price depends according to the cafe (usually around 1500 JPY).
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe Harajuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Is it possible to make your own samurai sword? Of course, if you have about 10 years of time to spend! However, the basic Japanese style knife making course takes just one day. This is an activity where you can experience and learn the specifics of this traditional culture. After completing the work, you can take the Japanese-style knife you made home with you. You will use the same tools used for Japanese sword making when you forge the knife in the morning. Lunch will be eaten at the smithy, and then in the afternoon you will complete the activity by shaping the knife. Please enjoy our traditional culture through experiencing Japanese-style knife making. The following is an example schedule for this activity: 8:30 to 9:00 (Pick-up at Gifu-Hashima Station) 9:00 to 11:30 forging the knife at the atelier 11:30 to 13:00 lunch 13:00 to 15:00 shaping the knife at the atelier 15:00 to 16:00 completing the work 16:00 to 16:30 end of the activity (we'll take you back to Gifu-Hashima Station) We will prepare lunch here for you. Please let us know if you have food restrictions for health reasons, religion, etc. The number of lunch options purchased should be lower than the total number of participants, because lunch is included in the price of the knife making activity. Please book the lunch-only option only for those people who will not participate in the knife making activity. This will be a private course exclusively for your group! Only if we are exceptionally busy, you may be asked to combine with with another group. Transportation access: Ride the Shinkansen (bullet train) to Gifu-Hashima Station. The following is the approximate time it takes from Japan's major cities: Kyoto - 30 min Tokyo - 1 hour and 50 min Nagoya - 10 min Osaka - 50 min If you're coming by car get off at Meishin Highway Gifu-Hashima IC and drive for 3 minutes to the station.
strTitle: Make your own samurai knife with a certified swordsmith!

strIntroduction: The Aokigahara, “sea of trees” spreads across the northwest base of Mt. Fuji, and is a forest growing atop the lava that flowed during the eruption of Mt. Fuji in 864 (the great eruption of the Jougan era), some 1,200 years ago. The Aokigahara woodlands spans approximately 3,000 hectares but has a soil depth of about 12 centimeters. It is also a highly unusual forest in that it is comprised primarily of hemlock fir, Japanese cypress, and other evergreen needle leaf trees, and broadleaf trees such as longstalk holly, Japanese andromeda, Mongolian oak, Fuji cherry, and maple. This tour will take you on a walking tour to experience the sea of trees. Listen to your nature guide who was officially sanctioned by the Kawaguchiko town to give tours. Your guide, who is an expert of Aokigahara will provide you with interesting facts about the area and will show you around safely. You can choose the duration of the tour: A) 1 hour Course B) 2 hours Course C) 3 hours Course D) 4 hours Course Why we love it: - A professional guide will walk through Aokigahara with you while presenting you with some important and interesting information about Aokigahara. - Feel the nature, and discover the woods! - You will go inside the Komoriana which literally means the bat caves. - You may happen to see bats if you are lucky! - Discover the mysterious woods of Aokigahara! This tour will make your trip unforgettable! Visit this beautiful forest full of amazing scenery, clean air, and a friendly guide! ※This activity does not offer child fee. Photo Credit : -https://flic.kr/p/jfBVcC -https://flic.kr/p/cZhE2 -https://flic.kr/p/ithUcb -https://flic.kr/p/hxUZ9r -https://flic.kr/p/8CzcUF -https://flic.kr/p/piA4d
strTitle: Explore Aokigahara, the Sea of Beautiful Trees!

strIntroduction: Enjoy this incomparable dinner when you visit Japan, and a once in a life time opportunity to view the elusive art of the Japanese Geisha! Our artists will entertain you with an elegant dance performance to traditional Japanese music. They will treat you like a VIP guest and you will have the unique chance to experience professional personalized service and attention from qualified and well-trained traditional artists! You can also book a more expensive luxury geisha event here: http://voyag.in/kagurazaka-geisha *We can offer this activity everyday, but due to the office being closed on Sundays, I cannot reply to urgent bookings on Sundays. *Please enter the number of Geisha you would like to book on the order page (a ratio of about 1:3 is recommended), and inform us of the number of people having dinner in the message field. *Please let us know if you have special preferences regarding the type of food you'd like for the dinner. We will make a reservation for the restaurant, and you will be able to have dinner with Geisha there. In general, we recommend a Japanese-style dinner in Omori Kaigan, or Japanese Kaiseki restaurant in Omori-Kaigan (About 10 mins from Shinagawa St.) both of which are old town districts of Geisha. The dinner we recommend includes a variety of little dishes with carefully prepared Japanese food: sashimi appetizers, pieces of sushi rolled in bamboo leaves, tempura of vegetables and seafood, simmered dishes, rice with eel, plenty of side dishes and traditional Japanese desserts. *Please note that dinner fee is not included, and it will cost around 4,000 to 10,000 yen per person. (It depends on which course menu you have)
strTitle: Enjoy Dinner with a Geisha Performance in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Join us in this private tour! Tsukiji Tokyo is one of the most celebrated gourmet cities in the world, and it is the famous Tsukiji Fish Market, with a total of 230,000m2 , that makes this possible. In accordance with the visiting rules established by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, a professional tour guide will show participants around the market safely in small groups of 4 or less. More than 480 different kinds of seafood are on display in the market ranging from fresh fish, to shell fish and, of course, the highly prized tuna. There may also be an opportunity to see a whole tuna being cut and filleted by one of the market’s skilled workers. No visit to Tokyo would be complete without experiencing Tsukiji Fish Market, and the busy shopkeepers and craftsmen who continue to work their traditional skills and way of life there. Asakusa Since the Edo period（1603-1868）Asakusa has been the most popular tourist site in Tokyo. Today, Asakusa remains the No.1 destination for foreign tourists. Nakamise street is the oldest shopping arcade in Tokyo, and is always bustling with visitors en route to Senso-ji Temple. Be transported back in time in Dempoin Street, where you can enjoy the atmosphere of the Edo period. Take in a ninja show at the Hanayashiki Amusement Park, or enjoy a ride on a traditional rickshaw. To really get a sense of Japanese life, why not visit a kimono shop where you will be able to try on a traditional kimono? Then take a walk in your kimono to the nearby Taiko Drum Museum. But, no matter where you are in Asakusa, you can be sure to find many delicious restaurants and souvenir shops. Starting from Tsukiji,public transportation, such as the JR or Metro lines. we will visit Asakusa. (Senso-ji Temple, Nakamise Street and Dempoin Street).The tour will conclude at Asakusa staion. (Ginza line or Asakusa line) Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/aDXPcU http://flic.kr/p/72zKCQ http://flic.kr/p/8kFc6K http://flic.kr/p/reQHg http://flic.kr/p/9iLzK4
strTitle: Explore Asakusa & Tsukiji Fish Market in This Private Tour!

strIntroduction: Lets focus on language exchange first and socialize afterwards in this casual activity. I have been teaching Japanese for a long time, and it's fun to exchange thoughts in our own languages. Why don't we socialize with each other? You can join a language exchange or socializing party or both. The schedule is as follows: 1. Language exchange (exchange in both Japanese and English or other foreign languages) 2. Socializing party in a bar that I recommend (you are welcome to suggest too) *please bring your own textbook if you have one The food and drinks are not included.
strTitle: Join a weekday night language exchange & socializing party

strIntroduction: Tokyo is one of the many unique cities in Japan that showcases both cultural heritage and the cutting-edge modernity which makes it a leading global city today. A great variety of arts and culture has developed in Tokyo, but the sheer number of museums can be daunting for the first-time or short-term visitor to navigate. In this experience, your hosts are designers and Artists in the fields of contemporary art, architecture, Design, fine art and crafts. They will listen to your requests and customise the best plan for exploring arts and culture in Tokyo according to your interests and objectives. The basic activity flow is as follows: 1. Meet at an appointed area 2. Plan a route together 3. Your hosts will take you on a detailed guided tour of art and design in Tokyo based on your specific interests Let’s explore the art scene in Tokyo together!
strTitle: Explore Art and Design in Tokyo on Customised Tours

strIntroduction: In this activity you will go to a special maid cafe in Akihabara where you will play Texas Holdem Poker with the local maids. This is a rare opportunity to experience playing the well-known card game with the famous Japanese maids! The price of this activity includes a limited number of chips that you can have for the game. When you lose all chips, the activity ends. You can play up to 2 hours. If the activity finishes earlier than 1 hour, I will show you around other interesting places in Akihabara. Cash will not be used, and the chips cannot be converted into money (gambling is illegal in Japan). The price includes also one drink. If you want to order additional drinks, separate charges will apply. Taking a photo with the cute maids will also require an extra fee. Please also pay the guide's entrance charge.
strTitle: Play Texas Holdem Poker in a maid cafe in Akihabara

strIntroduction: Geishas are women of the arts trained in traditional dancing, music, and singing. A Maiko is an apprentice Geisha who must undergo several years of training. Geishas and Maikos are distinguished by small but important differences in makeup, hair style, obi (fabric belt), and shoes. In this experience, you will have the opportunity to become a Maiko! We will be your personal liaison between you and the Geisha studio in Ginza. After confirming the availability with the studio, we will arrange your trip to the studio and help you along every step of the way in arriving at your destination. After that, you'll be in the experienced hands of the make-up artists and kimono coordinators. The staff at the studio can speak English. 1) Men and women can participate! 2) Children can participate if they can wear adult sizes (About 12 years old and over, young girls must be 135cm or taller and young boys must be 140 cm or taller). 2) The photographer will take 20 photos of you with a professional camera after you are fully dressed. 3) The photographer will select the 3 best photos, and you will receive them on a CD! The process is the same for all options. Why we love it: - Features a 2.5 hour make-up, hair styling, and outfit rental. - Make up and hair will be done by an experienced Geisha staff! - Select a beautiful kimono from over 20 options! - Have your pictures taken by a professional photographer after you are fully dressed. Take home a CD with the pictures! - Highly recommended by past customers who described the experience as "wonderful," "the highlight of my trip," and "memorable". - Valid all the way through December 31st. Option Details: *Please choose a starting time between 10:00-18:00. A) Kimono Experience for women or men (Price per person) - Kimono attire for 1 female or 1 male - Make up - Photo session together with your group (in case you would like a couple photo, you need to book "B) Couple photo session (price per couple)" - Photo Data B) Kimono Experience for a couple (Price per couple) *Please note this option is only available for a 1 male and 1 female couple - Kimono attire for 1 female and hakama attire for 1 male - Make up for 1 person - Photo session together - Photo Data C) Hakama Experience for women or men (Price per person) - Hakama attire for 1 female or 1 male - Photo session together with your group (in case you would like a couple photo, you need to book "B) Couple photo session (price per couple)" - Photo Data
strTitle: 15% OFF Become a Maiko (Geisha) Experience in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Follow your own personal maid guide on a private tour as she takes you deep into the heart of Akihabara, to discover the places tourists don't usually get to go... She will take you to the centre of the anime and manga culture which began in Akihabara. You'll also have a unique experience at a real Japanese maid cafe! On this two and a half hour walking tour, your guide will provide an unforgettable experience of all things Akihabara that you won’t be able to find in the guidebooks. We have guides fluent in English, Japanese and Mandarin - ask them anything about Akihabara, Tokyo, or Japan in general. Due to the popularity of the tour, you may be interviewed by the Japanese media, but if you are uncomfortable with this idea please let us know, and we'll make sure that you're left in peace. Please let us know the following info when you make the booking. - Names of each participant - Ages - Genders - Nationality - Contact phone number - Hotel name - Duration of stay in Japan Thanks! We run our tours every day, from 11am, 3pm, or 6pm If possible, when you request a tour please provide two alternative requested tour dates and times in your message to help us ensure we can fit you in. We're looking forward to seeing you in Akihabara!
strTitle: Akihabara Tour with Your Own Personal Maid!

strIntroduction: Karate is a form of Japanese martial arts focusing on the power of one's own body without the use of weapons and protective gear. Karate is not only a great form of exercise, but is also a good form of stress relief and becoming popular amongst women. In this lesson you'll be able to learn basic Karate techniques as well as experience the cultural practices surrounding the art form. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to wear a real karate uniform that you can purchase and take home after the lesson if you desire. - Experience the formal culture, rituals, and rules surrounding Karate- including lesson opening and closing formalities. - Receive a live demonstration from Karate masters. - Learn warm-ups used to prepare one's body properly for Karate. - Become familiar with the technique for basic kicks and punches. - Perform pair exercises to practice, reinforce, and hone learned techniques.
strTitle: Take Karate Lessons from a Black Belt Master

strIntroduction: There is really nothing special about coffee shops. It’s usually a place to simply relax, drink some coffee, and perhaps read a book or magazine. What if all the waiters were butlers though? What if all the waiters were butlers that looked like they just stepped out of a manga? Would that be weird? Exciting? Interesting? Find out how you’d feel at a Butler Café in Tokyo! We’ll introduce you to one of the most unforgettable experiences you’ll have in Japan. Have the butlers call you prince or princess! It’ll be a great story to tell when you get back home.
strTitle: Go to a Butler Cafe in Tokyo

strIntroduction: I am a researcher and a teacher of Sumo - all the interesting stuff about it, the loooong history, the secrets and how the Sumo world is actually a mirror of the old Japanese society...your jaw will drop and you will have a lot of fun finding out about those things. (^-^)v Tokyo Riverside School (Japanese Language Institution) provides a Sumo lesson of 2 hours - think of it like a university lecture but a very entertaining one. This is the basis of this offer plus X. I taught about Sumo at universities, held uncountable public presentations and currently I teach it to our Japanese language students at Tokyo Riverside School. The lecture is available in Japanese, English and German . Depending on when you are in Tokyo, we could visit Sumo practice or a tournament, the Sumo museum, Sumo Shrines etc. together or have “Chanko”, Sumo food! (Won't make you fat and I will tell you why ;-) ) Maybe even dinner with a Rikishi (wrestler)... Many things are possible, but most cannot be planned long before coming here. Please CONTACT ME FIRST about such things and we set up a plan. The Sumo lecture at Tokyo Riverside School is possible almost every weekday of the year, big groups of people are no problem. Ask any question afterwards. Since we are only 3 minutes away from Sensoji Temple / Asakusa Shrine, let's also go there after the lesson. Tokyo Sky Tree is also close. We are awaiting our new Sumo students! Please also see the Japanese Mini Class we offer as well, taught by a routined Japanese language Teacher - even a tourist, there are phrases and sentences you should know. Ozzz! (Sumo greeting…)
strTitle: Learn the Mysteries of Sumo from an Expert

strIntroduction: Come to my house and learn how to make Wagashi (traditional Japanese sweets & confectionery) in Shibuya, Tokyo! Wagashi is typical Japanese sweet comprising sweet red been paste, rice cake, and some special ingredients. My goal is to introduce this skill to travellers visiting Japan so everyone can enjoy making Wagashi and matching it with Japanese green tea. We make Japanese traditional sweets - regular or seasonal. Both come with green tea. === Regular menu=== Nerikiri - The most famous Wagashi, a unique shape made of sweet white bean paste === Seasonal menu === Mochi sweets Feel free to come and relax and have fun learning to make Wagashi together! I look forward to seeing you soon! Photo by: https://flic.kr/p/9ApyLY
strTitle: Make Wagashi! Traditional Japanese Sweets in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The world of sumo attracts plenty of foreign visitors in Japan who want to experience the exciting emotion of seeing sumo wrestlers fight against each other. However, the national tournaments are held only several times per year and in different cities. Booking a sumo morning practice tour will give you access directly to the wrestlers' home, but even those tours are not held every week. If you have no chance to see sumo wrestlers fighting in real, or if you want to enhance the valuable memories from your trip to Japan with a personal interaction with wrestlers, then this is the ideal occasion! In the past many visitors have been asking how to get a chance to duel a sumo wrestler on a one-to-one friendly fight, and this is no longer impossible! By attending this special show in Asakusa you will have the rare opportunity to try your luck and strength against a real sumo wrestler, learn more about the traditional techniques used during the tournaments, and eat a well-balanced healthy chanko-nabe hot pot! This is a special event offered entirely in English for international visitors in Tokyo. The show is offered every Monday from 11:45 am under the following schedule: 11:45 - the venue opens 12:00 - start of the stage show in which two former sumo wrestlers will show essential techniques, explain about the history, culture and practices of sumo, and fight against each other. Several people from the audience will be picked to dress in a funny sumo wrestler costume (don't worry, you will not need to take off any clothes) and challenge the former stars in a duel. Photo time will end this session. Note: Not every visitor will be chosen to duel with the sumo wrestlers. 12:50 - chanko-nabe hot pot will be served for lunch. You can try the delicious traditional food eaten by sumo wrestlers and learn more about their diet. The nutritious meal has been cooked by the wrestlers themselves and includes hot pot with seasonal ingredients (not vegetarian), rice, miso, salad, fries, yuzu citrus dessert and a non-alcoholic drink. The event ends after you finish your lunch. You will also receive the current sumo ranking as a present. This is a group event and there will be other guests in the hall (up to 50 people). The hall has tatami mats and you will be sitting on a cushion on the floor (a chair will be provided for guests with limited mobility). Note: Be punctual because the show will start exactly at 12:00 pm. Enjoy the unique sumo wrestlers show and have unforgettable memories from your trip to Japan!
strTitle: Duel with sumo wrestlers and eat chanko nabe in Asakusa show

strIntroduction: Arashiyama is a scenic spot in Kyoto where the cultural flavors and colors of the ancient royal court have been preserved. Take a moment to walk through the noted Tenryuji Temple, listen to the rustle of the bamboo leaves and cross the Togetsukyo Bridge, over the Oi River. Wander around the sites and in the shoes of the ancient people. Our government-licensed tour guides will show you around with warm hospitality and total dedication. Since this is a private tour, your guide will take care of you from the beginning till the end. The starting time of the tour is flexible, but it's recommended to start either between 9:00-10:00 in the morning or around 13:00 in the afternoon. Okochi Mountain Villa ↓ Nonomiya Shrine ↓ Tenryuji Temple ↓ Togetsukyo Bridge ↓ End of tour (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel) == Okochi Mountain Villa == Okochi Mountain Villa is the villa and garden of samurai film star Denjiro Okochi (1898-1962). The grounds of the villa, located on the slopes of Mt. Ogura, are a traditional Japanese strolling garden that includes a garden, tea houses and shrines. The garden is vast and has a sense of elegance and austere simplicity. Okochi was a well-known pious Buddhist who built the Jibutsudo, a Zen meditation hall. It was said that Okochi wanted to create the perfect garden with everlasting beauty to contrast with beauty captured on film that deteriorates over time. Do you think he felt the end result was perfect? When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target. ～George Fisher == Nonomiya Shrine == Nonomiya Shrine is a Shinto shrine where, in ancient times, unmarried imperial princesses stayed for a year or more to purify themselves afterwhich they were sent to Ise Shrine in Mie prefecture to serve as a representative of the Imperial family. The shrine famously appears in the tenth chapter of the Tale of Genji, a classic work of Japanese literature from the eleventh century and the world's first novel. The black torii (gate) at the entrance of the shrine is an example of the earliest style of torii - unlike later versions, the bark is exposed. It has become a popular destination for young singles who come to pray for marriage. == Tenryuji Temple == Tenryuji Temple, the head quarters of the Rinzai school of Zen Buddhism, is the top-ranked among Kyoto's Five ZenTemples. The shogun Ashikaga Takauji built the temple in 1339 to comfort the spirit of the late Emperor Godaigo who passed away on Mt. Yoshino in Nara prefecture. This temple's garden, designed by the priest Muso Soseki, became the model for all later gardens that incorporate nature as a backdrop for their designs. It features a circular promenade around Sogen Pond, allowing visitors to enjoy the scenery of the garden from a variety of vantage points. == Togetsukyo Bridge == The name "Togetsukyo",meaning "Moon Crossing Over the Bridge", comes from a description of the bridge written by Emperor Kameyama in the 14th century. He wrote that , as the moon traverses the sky , it appears as if the moon is crossing over the bridge. Visitors are enchanted by the picture perfect scenery of the cherry blossoms in spring or the colorful changing leaves in autumn. Togetsukyo Bridge crosses the Oi River, well-known for its beautiful reflection of nearby Arashiyama.. There are popular boat rides around the bridge., and at night you can also witness traditional cormorant fishing, in which retrieves fish from the throats of cormorants.
strTitle: Join Kyoto Arashiyama Bamboo and Tenryu-ji Private Tour

strIntroduction: This course highlights two UNESCO Cultural Heritage sites: Itsukushima Shinto Shrine, seemingly floating in the sea during high tide and Hiroshima Peace memorial (Genbaku Dome), a constant reminder of the terrible atomic bomb attack. You will take the Shinkansen bullet train to Hiroshima Station where our government-licensed guides will meet you and take you to Miyajima and the Peace Memorial Park. At the end of the tour you will return to Osaka or Kyoto by Shinkansen. 7:30 Meet your guide at Kyoto or Shin-Osaka station. Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Kyoto or Shin-Osaka to Hiroshima. ↓ Miyajima ↓ Itsukushima Shrine ↓ Atomic-Bomb Dome ↓ Peace Memorial Museum ↓ End of tour in Osaka or Kyoto after taking the return Shinkansen bullet train (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel.) Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/agustinrafaelreyes/6708266103/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/nam2_7676/8058759143/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/cyber0515/5451030994/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/victor_lee/7428093854/in/photostream/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/xile/53781614/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/throgers/6823843830/
strTitle: A daytrip to Hiroshima from Osaka/Kyoto by bullet train

strIntroduction: "Take a thrilling ride down Fuji River (Fujikawa) on this half day rafting tour! We will start at Hatakeyama and end at Hourai-bashi (Horai Bridge). Total length: 6km long, Estimated time: 3.5 hours There are 2 session for this half day rafting tour: Morning (9:00), and Afternoon (13:30) From around October, there will be 1 half-day rafting tour held each day, beginning at 10:00 am. Location: Fujinomiya City, Shizuoka (Fuji River---Shiba River) Meeting place: River Base. (You will get more details after the booking is confirmed) ~ITINERARY~ 9:00 （13:30）Registration and briefing 9:20 （13:50）Change clothes for rafting 9:35 （13:35）Move to start point 9:40 （14:00）Check safety equipments 9:45 （14:15）Instruction about how to row, how not to fall, & what to do if you fall into the river 10:00 （14:30）Rafting Tour begin! 11:00 （15:30）Raft through the 6km course of a very dynamic river! strIntroduction: This easy and valuable experience starts from Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal or at the selected hotel for picking up, and heads to Kamakura by bus. The first stop is the Great Buddha, the symbol of Kamakura and one of the most famous attractions in Japan. The Great Buddha is the property of the Kotoku-in Buddhist temple of the Jodoshu sect and visitors are often overwhelmed by its majestic appearance. With an additional fee you can access the inside of the statue offering a unique experience and allowing you to see the casting technology of the Kamakura Age. The next spot is Hasedera Temple which is famous a variety of flowers that bloom all year around and can see the beautiful sea cost of Yuigahama from the Temple’s compound. A hydrangea of over 40 different kinds bloom between June and July in the Temple and is a very popular event. Enjoy the landscape of the colorful hydrangea and the impressive sea coast view of Kamakura while feeling the elegance of Japan. After a Japanese style lunch the afternoon program starts from Sankeien Garden in Yokohama which is famous for its beautiful scenery. Here, old buildings have been gathered from all over Japan showing various architectural styles and which are designated as a national cultural asset. This elegant garden retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city shows a natural beauty with seasonal flowers such as Cherry blossom, Azalea, Iris, Lotus and Autumn leaves. A lot of Japanese paintings are also exhibited in the memorial hall. At Sankeien Garden, you can immerse yourself in the world of Japanese elegance and beauty. The tours final stop will take you to the largest Chinatown in Japan and East Asia where you can stroll along eating local snacks and taking pictures while viewing the decorations of the streets and looking for unique souvenirs. The schedule for this one-day tour is as follows: -07:30- 09:00 Pickup at select Tokyo hotels as below or check-in at: 08:20 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 07:40 Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel 08:10 Conrad Tokyo 08:15 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel -09:00 Departure from Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal Kotokuin Temple and the Great Buddha (30 minutes) Hasedera Temple (40 minutes) Lunch Sankeien Garden (60 minutes) Yokohama Chinatown (30 minutes) Yokohama Bay Bridge (drive-over) -17:00-18:00 Drop-off in Ginza -17:40-18:40 Tour disbands at Shinjuku Station *You may leave the tour in either Ginza or Shinjuku.
strTitle: Discover Kamakura and Yokohama on a 1-Day Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: In the sacred land of Nikko 103 buildings of two Shinto shrines and a Buddhist temple are registered in the UNESCO World Heritage list. Among them 9 are the National Treasuries and 94 are the Important Cultural properties in Japan. You will discover great flamboyant architectural beauties! Just at Toshogu Shrine you can admire 5,173 carvings of flowers, the famous sleeping cat, the three wise monkeys and more. Walking along the ancient lanterns and the cedar trees can lead you to the ancient world as well. This sacred mountain's history dates back to the 8th century. Almost all buildings of Toshogu Shrie were rebuilt in 1634 by the third Shogun, Iemitsu. Rinnoji Temple is his mausoleum. The buildings impressed with the expression of wealth and might of the Tokugawa clan. It used to be said, “Don’t say you have seen the best until you visit Nikko”. The basic route is as follows, though the route can be changed upon your request: Meet at Asakusa Station and ride the express train. It takes about two hours. When we arrive at Nikko, let’s have a lunch at a restaurant. Then take the local bus and see the red wooden bridge through the window. Visit the Toshogu Shrine first and enjoy watching the giant pagoda, the Sacred Stable, the Yomeimon Gate and enter the Haiden hall that only the upper class of lords during the Edo period were allowed to access. Go to the shrine and grave of the shogun Ieyasu. Listen to the voice of the “Crying Dragon” at another building! Next go to Futarasan Shrine built in the 8th century through under the cedars trees. Take a short break at a small coffee or a tea house next to the natural fountain. There are many interesting things to see such as the old lantern cut by Japanese swords, a long sword, a spot to check your luck of the day etc. Go back to the station and back to Asakusa in Tokyo by train. If we have time, and you have more energy, we can also visit Rinnoji Temple. The shrines are located close but one complex itself consists of too many buildings and places to see. If you have interest in Japanese art, let’s go to museums and you can see splendid artworks such as painting on Japanese slide doors by the famous painter Yokoyama Taikan or beautiful swords. In this case, you have to give up on visiting another shrine, Futarasan.
strTitle: Take a one day trip to Nikko's World Heritage Shrines

strIntroduction: As you walk around the city of Kamakura, you will experience the history and culture of Japan. There are many shrines and temples that hold treasures, and the atmosphere will take you back in time! Kamakura is the perfect place for you to go sightseeing! Enjoy this tour and explore the ancient city of Kamakura! 10:00 AM Depart Shinjuku Station Around 11:30, we will arrive at Hase Station. Visit Hase Dera (Hase Kannon) Hase Dera is located on top of a hill. You will see the giant statue of Kannon, the goddess of mercy, and see the amazing view of the sea. The statue of Kannon is the tallest wooden image in Japan. It has 11 heads, each with different expressions to represent Kannon's compassion for all kinds of human suffering. Visit Kamakura Daibutsu See the great buddha of Kamakura! It is a statue of Amida Buddha, which was cast in 1252. This statue is the second largest monumental Buddha in Japan. Lunch Eat lunch around Hase Station! There are many different types of food you can eat. Relax and re-energize for your trip afterwards! A. (Summer/ Spring Season)Get on the train to Yuigahama Station - Walk to Yuigahama Beach Enjoy a walk along Yuigahama beach, one of the most popular beach spots in Japan! Relax, sit on the sand and enjoy the summer weather of Japan! We will ride the train to Kamakura Station afterwards. B. (Autumn/ Winter Season) Get on the train to Kamakura Station - Visit Myohonji Temple Myohonji Temple is one of the Nichiren Buddhism temples in Japan. It is the tallest temple in Japan. Go explore the hidden treasures in this beautiful temple. After visiting Myohonji Temple, we will be moving on to other amazing places near Kamakura Station! Visit Komachi Dori Komachi Dori is a very lively street, full of many small shops! You can purchase traditional Japanese sweets for snacks and eat it as you walk along this street! There are many souvenir shops as well! Visit Tsuruoka Hachimanguu Shrine At the end of Komachi Dori, we will get to the most important shrine in Kamakura. Founded in 1063, you will walk along a wide, spacious street until you reach the shrine. The view and atmosphere of this street will take you back in time. Walk to Sasukeinari Shrine Enjoy the walk from Tsuruoka Hachimanguu Shrine to Sasukeinari Shrine. Reach the shrine by going through a nice tunnel of tori gates with red flags. Witness statues of foxes along the way! Walk back to Kamakura Station and ride back to Shinjuku Station Around 6:30 PM, we will take the train back to Shinjuku Station. We will get back to Shinjuku Station around 7:30 PM. As a famous sightseeing spot in Japan, Kamakura will offer you the experience to get in touch with the history and culture of Japan. You will be seeing many shrines, temples, and statues. Depending on the season, you will see many seasonal flowers blooming along the streets! Depending on your tour date, you may be able to attend events that are held at the shrines/temples we visit! Estimated Cost for Own Transportation and Shrine/Temple Entrance Fee -Shinjuku to Hase Station (One Way) - 1080JPY -Kamakura Daibutsu Entrance Fee - 200JPY Option 2: -Hase station to Kamakura Station - 190JPY -Myohonji Temple Entrance Fee-100JPY Photo Credits: https://flic.kr/p/o1W4VB https://flic.kr/p/mY84qH https://flic.kr/p/8E4XDP https://flic.kr/p/fBYbEt https://flic.kr/p/dxByLT
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 Day Private Tour Around Kamakura!

strIntroduction: Get the best of Tokyo in a single day! Don’t have enough time to travel around all of Tokyo? Don’t worry! This one day tour is made for people like you who would like to enjoy as much of Tokyo as possible. After completing this tour you will have visited most of Tokyo's major tourist hot spots. We can arrange the itinerary as you like. ■ ASAKUSA ■ We start with the most popular tourist area, Asakusa. Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. Walking through the ancestral Japanese atmosphere you might be surprised at how Japanese religious customs are available to anyone and how Japanese time-honored manners have matured. You’ll experience the proper way to visit the temple & shrine, how to purify yourself, how to pray, and what a Japanese fortuneteller is like. You'll also see the symbol of Japan's state-of-the-art construction, Tokyo Sky Tree. This is currently the highest tower in the world at 634 meters. ■ The West side of Tokyo ■ After a walk inside one of the most traditional areas of Tokyo, we’ll cross the city to meet the trendy young generation of Japanese in west Tokyo. Open your eyes, you might be surprised! At Shibuya, we’ll see a statue of a loyal dog named ‘Hachi’ and the famous crossing nearby. We'll continue walking around attractive shopping areas like 109, and have a lunch break. If you like to have sushi, we’ll take you to a sushi restaurant. This quite unique sushi restaurant is in Shibuya. Many tourists want to eat sushi here! In the afternoon, we’ll move to Harajuku. We’ll visit Meiji Jingu which is one of the biggest Shinto-related shrines in Japan, and hustle and bustle Takeshita Street filled with teenagers across Japan. You can enjoy this contrast between holy atmosphere and secular world. This tour’s last destination is Shinjuku. We’ll see a famous entertaining district of Kabuki-cho (no relation with old theater performance of Kabuki) and Omoide Yokocho, an area of casual taverns for Japanese business people. This west tour shows you not only old and new, but also sacred and secular aspects of Tokyo! ★★On this tour we cover★★ ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asaksa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Shibuya ・Hachiko dog stature ・Crossing ・Centergai street ・109 ・Lunch ■ Harajuku ・Meiji Jingu Shrine ・Takeshita Shopping Street（Daiso: the biggest 100Yen Shop, Purikura） ■ Shinjuku ・skyscrapers ・Omoideyokocho alley ・Kabukicho ・Don Quijote(final stop) ★★Let’s talk. “More Knowledge, More Fun”★★ ・The difference between Buddhism and Shinto ・How to pray in a Shinto way ・How Japanese subculture is like ・Japanese traditional wedding ceremony
strTitle: Private West Tokyo One Day Tour

strIntroduction: From high-class whiskey bars to pulsating disco clubs, Kyoto indeed has an amazing array of bars, pubs and "izakaya” (Japanese tapas bar) . As you visit Kyoto, you get a chance to explore a number of curious and exciting and uniquely Japanese nightlife venues, such as the mushroom bar and the bar where samurai's once drank featuring a half sized door (designed to make you disarm your sword before entering) or the dark bar light up only by candle light and playing chilled ambient beats. So, let's get together and explore all these memorable and fun places in Kyoto. The tour will include visits to at least one izakaya (for some pub snacks and drinks), a small bar (for a drink or two) and a fun place to let loose and dance or a classy bar to finish off the night depending on the mood. While the tour officially ends at midnight, it has been known to go a little later :) Do you want to learn some Japanese phrases and expressions before the tour? Sign up for the option for a Japanese lesson before we head out and get a chance to use what you learned during the tour. This is a fun and exciting chance to see Kyoto from a local resident's perspective. Kyoto has some of the best bars (and bartenders) on the planet so I am sure that when you take this tour I am sure that you will have a night to remember for many years to come. Every Thursday Night this tour includes 1hr of all you can drink and snacks from a limited at the first location and a lot more fun to come throughout the night. Inquire now to book your place!
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Bar Hopping Experience!

strIntroduction: Tsukiji Market is the biggest and most famous seafood market in the world. Eating in famous sushi restaurants is nice, but it's really touristy! This eating and walking tour will let you experience Tsukiji Market like a local! You will taste various types of delicious Japanese seafood and drinks and learn about Japanese culture by walking around with a local guide. Schedule: 8:30am Meet your local guide at Tsukiji Honganji Temple. Walk to the market together, and tour the different areas. Stop at 6 places for food and drink. Included Food/Drinks: -Japanese omelette -Dried bonito -Fresh oyster -Sushi -Sake -Fried fish cake 12:00pm Finish at Tsukiji Market. The whole town is your restaurant! Let's eat and drink all around Tsukiji!!
strTitle: Tokyo Food and Drink Tour at Tsukiji Market (From 8:30am~)

strIntroduction: What comes to your mind when you think of Japan? Many people first think of the image of Mt. Fuji! Since it was registered as a World Heritage site, Mt. Fuji is becoming more and more popular among not only tourists but also the Japanese. Mt.Fuji is the biggest mountain in Japan at a height of 3776m. This guided one-day tour includes a stop at the Fuji Visitor Center, a trip up to Mt. Fuji's 5th station at an elevation of 2,300 meters, a cruise on pristine Lake Ashi, and a ride on the Mt. Komagatake Ropeway which boasts great views of the surrounding Hakone National Park. You will be speechless when you see Mt. Fuji with the beautiful lake. Come join this tour if you want an easy way to experience Mt. Fuji! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Besides, we are offering this tour at VIP ver limitedly. strIntroduction: In Japan we have 4 seasons and in each season we can find different fish and vegetables, which makes our food culture varied. So first, let's explore a market in Temma, which is just 1 station from JR Osaka, and I'll explain seasonal Japanese ingredients and we'll buy what we need for our cooking. Then we'll go back home and cook some Japanese food. Examples of the menus of Japanese dishes: You will cook 1 main dish, 1 side dish, Miso soup, and Japanese rice. The example of the main menus are as following, Sushi Roll Okonomiyaki Yakisoba Tempura Sashimi Karaage Teriyaki Ginger-flavored steak. Niku-jaga. Oyako-don Tonkatsu (Katsu) or katsudon Sukiyaki Duke-don Saba no Misoni Gyudon Takikomi Gohan and so on... or you can choose one ingredient for the main dish, for example, beef, pork, chicken, fish or tofu... then I can arrange the menu for you :) Language: English. Meeting place: JR Temma station 1 station from JR Osaka or Subway Ogimachi station Exit 1 (Sakaisuji "brown" line)
strTitle: Enjoy a market tour and Japanese home cooking in Osaka!

In addition, Burlesque Tokyo is one of the very few places in Japan where tipping is not only allowed, but encouraged - you can freely tip the girls and show them how much you enjoy their attractive show! strIntroduction: Kyoto was the second capital of Japan from 794-1868 with 72 Emperors and 3 Shoguns legacy. Many national treasures and important cultural assets are the remains of such history. Needless to say, there are many hidden and interesting sites to explore in Kyoto. Samurai guide, Joe Okada will introduce some of the aforementioned sites on this tour. As an experienced tour guide, Joe Okada knows Kyoto inside out. He personally escorts you for 4 km, walked in about 5 hours. Let’s enjoy cool Kyoto with the cool samurai! Schedule: 9:45 We will meet at Kyoto City Hall Plaza. You can reach Kyoto City Hall Plaza from Kyoto Shiyakusho-Mae Station (station number T12) on the subway Tozai Line. 10:00 We will walk along Teramachi Street and visit various specialty shops including those with wood engravings, the best paper and tea, and Japanese brushes and inks. You will also have the opportunity to visit a Shinto shrine and a Buddhist temple. 11:30 We will then walk through the Kyoto Imperial Palace forest and enjoy a special visit to the Shusui-tei garden, complete with a centuries-old tea house for nobility. We will walk by the 25 million dollar Kyoto State Guest House, where U.S. President George W. Bush had a press conference in 2005. 13:00 We will relax and enjoy the “Face to Face Market” and try some pre-arranged sample foods! 14:30 You will have the opportunity to watch a very rare samurai sword demonstration, "Cutting Apple in Air," by Samurai Joe. 15:00 The tour disbands. You may revisit the shops, or visit nearby sites including Daitokuji, Ginkakuji, and Nijo Castle. Availability: Group Tour - Every Saturday Semi Private Tour - Your requested date except Saturday I offer his tours every Saturday for groups of 10 people or more. If your group is smaller then 10, please inquire as you may still be able to join the tour with others. Also, you can book your own private tour at a flat rate on Saturdays and weekdays - please ask! *Children under 12 years are free but they need to cover food fee in cash for 1000JPY.
strTitle: Cool Kyoto Walking Tour with the Last Samurai
