strIntroduction: Samurai culture is one of the best recognized Japanese cultures in the world. In movies or shows, people get excited seeing strong men dressed in out of ordinary costumes destroy enemies as they wave Japanese swords artistically. This culture has always been the most known all the time and the influence of the Japanese video games, anime and movies help to raise its popularity nowadays. To experience such Samurai culture, Voyagin has an experience in which participants can enjoy the atmosphere of Iaido (one type of Japanese swordsmanship) and traditional Japanese manners at the same time. They will be instructed the fundamental movement from the master and later they get to see master’s technique and skills. This is not just sword fights nor sword dances, it is one of the classic Japanese swordsmanship, Iaijutsu which has over 400 years of history. This lesson is for those who want to try the orthodox swordsmanship and we will teach courteously to everyone. This time, we cut down all the cost we could remove so that people can try this experience out at a reasonable price. Note: On rainy days it is possible to use venues such as public facilities and private dojos that require extra rental fee (about 400 JPY per person, to be paid on the day). If you need rental "gi" wear, please tell me your body size in advance (it might be not possible to arrange rental wear in all cases). It will cost 2000 JPY per person (please pay on the day).
strTitle: Learn Traditional Japanese Swordsmanship

strIntroduction: Come join us at our full-service Taiko studio! Taiko refers to a range of traditional Japanese drums, which are often played both for leisure and at festivals and celebrations. In this activity, you will experience: 1) Full line-up of Japanese drums, from O-Daiko, Nagadodaiko, Shimedaiko, and Okedodaiko that you are free to try. 2) Basic striking techniques, stance, and rhythms. 3) Learn traditional Japanese songs and show off your skills with a group performance at the end of the activity.
strTitle: Learn to Play Taiko

strIntroduction: The area now known as Akihabara was once a major crossroads of Edo, a neighborhood where samurai and commoner, lordly estates and tenements, shops and temples all mixed. See how it was transformed from one of the city's main gates into one of Tokyo's major transportation hubs and then into the center of all things electronic in Japan. We will jump through time exploring Akihabara's rich history - visiting one of Tokyo's oldest temples, dedicated to a rebellious samurai lord whose wrathful spirit has brought death and disaster to Edo, and then walk remnants of the post-WWII black markets. You will see the shift to its current incarnation as an otaku mecca, and also see the world's largest statue of Confucius. Fire and water shaped the area, and you learn how it came to be called Akihabara and the very unusual location of one its primary shrines!
strTitle: Visit Akihabara: Historic Neighborhood and Electronics Mecca

strIntroduction: At 6:30pm, we'll meet at Tenma Station (on the JR loop line, just one stop from Umeda), which puts us right in the middle of a very old part of Osaka. First, we'll head to neighboring Ogimachi Park, taking in the views and getting oriented. Then it's time to dive in to Tenma proper! While walking around, I'll be sure to point out lots of interesting sights. After about thirty minutes of walking around, we'll stop for our first drink and bit of food for the night, in the heart of Tenma. Food will vary by restaurant and your tastes over the course of the evening, but typical dishes include "kushi katsu" (fried food on sticks), "dote nikomi" (slow cooked beef... parts), "tonpei yaki" (a grilled pork and egg dish), and some healthier things as well -- I promise! After some time in Tenma, we'll hop on a train for the short ride to Kyobashi, where the vibe is a bit grittier, but equally fun! It's an old area, but it's by no means dangerous at all, so don't worry one bit about that. In Kyobashi, we'll walk around about 15 minutes before stopping at a "standing bar" for more food and a drink of so. A bit more exploring, and we'll stop and one final place to round out the night. Osaka is famous for its food, and you're going to see it all tonight! Your tour will take you to three different open bars that also serve food and the two neighborhoods of Tenma and Kyobashi. The cost of the tour does not include food or drinks, but does include the train ticket between the two neighborhoods. Expect food and drinks to run 3000-4000 JPY over the course of the evening, depending how much you eat and drink. If you're a big a fan of fine Japanese whisky, consider adding the "Premium Japanese whisky tasting" option at checkout. You'll get a three whisky flight (25ml/.85 oz. each) highlighting some of the recently much ballyhooed whisky of Japan, all in a cool, hidden bar off a tiny alley. The tour is limited to a maximum of four people, but is not strictly a private tour. There is a possibility that others may join your tour, but that four person limit is never exceeded. Start time is suggested to be 6:30pm, but it can be made a bit earlier or later by request.
strTitle: Enjoy an adventurous evening of food and drink in Osaka

strIntroduction: The ship takes you to Yokohama Bay Area with beautiful Yokohama night view. The ship cruise is famous as Yokohama Night Spots. You can spend a romantic time while having a cocktail or soft drink. Boarding Place: Pier Aka-renga, located on the back of the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse (15 mins walk from Bashamichi Sta.No.6 Exit of Minatomirai Line) Departing Time: Jan: 18:55 Feb: 19:55 Mar: 19:55 Apr: 19:55 May: 20:30 June: 20:55 July: 20:55 Aug: 20:30 Sept: 19:55 Oct: 19:55 Nov: 18:55 Dec: 18:55
strTitle: Enjoy a Relaxing Cruise under the Night Sky

strIntroduction: Have fun with cute lovely owls in Kyoto city as a rest from your sightseeing around Japan's old capital! Spend one hour of relaxation with the adorable animals! At first, a member of the staff carefully explains the proper way to handle the owl to avoid any harm to you and the owl. Please listen attentively to their explanation so that you can enjoy an amazing time with the owls. Here is the flow of the experience: - enter the shop and hear the instructions of the staff (first 15 minutes of the experience) - spend time with the owls (for about 35 minutes) - end of the experience You'll then need to clean your hands with hand sanitizer before you can touch and pet the owls. After your time is up, you'll be able to visit the gift shop and find a unique owl-related souvenir! Other rules to observe: - only the staff can bring and take away the owls. - don't let go off the leash. - avoid touching the owls anywhere else except for their heads. - turn off the flash when taking a photo. This is definitely a rare, unique experience that you should definitely not miss while you are visiting Japan! Reserve your seat now! It is also possible to rent the entire place for 1 hour! Available for up to 20 people at once! The opening time of the cafe in Kyoto is as follows: Weekday: 12:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Weekend: 11:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Closed: Mondays
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe, Kyoto

strIntroduction: Our ancestors came to Tokyo over 400 years ago, following a feudal lord named Tokugawa Ieyasu, who founded the Tokugawa Shogunate in 1603. As the Shibatas had loyal ninjas, our ancestors could serve the government as heads of "Onmitsu" ninjas. If you check about your host's great grandfather, Shibata Takenaka, you can see our linage. As our ancestors worked for Tokugawa Shogunate for 265years, you can find some historical documents in libraries and the ministry of foreign affairs, which is rather unique, as most of ninja histories have been kept secret. In our clan we have crafted our weapons for over 400 years. You'll see some of the weapons hand-crafted by your host(ess) and her father. In your session, you will learn what our novices learn in his/her first class. The schedule is as follows: 1. Meditation 2. Change to a ninja outfit 3. Introduction to Ninja weapons 4. Practice Ninja Star techniques 5. Practice Boshuriken 6. Practice blowgun 7. Elective (Tell us what you want to learn - kunai, sword, introduction to shinagan waza, etc.) 8. Practice Kujikiri (well-wishing) technique 9. Photo time (Take photos with the ninjas) -Meditation The art of ninjutsu is more than learning the physical skills of the martial arts. It is also about finding your inner-self through physical conditioning, meditation, and discipline. With the practice of meditation, one develops key elements of increased awareness and detachment while increasing his/her sense of inner peace. It is through meditation that ninjas learn how to reach the "Ku" (no-self, void), and to control the energy called "Ki" which is the essential life force existing in all things in the universe. In meditation a ninja seeks to get to the "Ku no kyochi" (state of no-self) by integrating his/her body and mind. This state of mind gives a ninja the power to block out everything except the task at hand by using a sense of extreme calm and enhanced concentration. -Kujikiri Kujikiri is a series of nine symbolic hand gestures. It invokes the spiritual and mental strength. The hand signs are believed to be able to channel energy. The hand signs were taken from the practices of the early buddhists. They are used to build confidence and strength in the practitioner. They are also believed to enhance one’s senses of danger and enable one to foresee death. -Weapons See some of the famous weapons made by our master weaponsmith. -Elective Training Our training menu is made up based on the idea of Gorin (The Five Element Code, kunai, katana, taijutsu, etc.) Introducing Waza (skill) Shingan no sen Jitte http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kH_EjA0OuLI *If your requested starting time is after 9pm, or between 6am and 8pm, please pay for the Ninjas' overnight stay fee at the Dojo. You can make the payment by purchasing the "[Add-on] Ninja Overnight Stay Fee" in addition to your experience fee.
strTitle: Be a Ninja: Learn Five Basic Techniques

strIntroduction: This is a 3-hour tour around the tea plantations in Shizuoka prefecture. 【Tea Plantation】 The host will guide you to the top of the mountain and tell you the history and production methods of the organic tea plantation founded in 1975. If the weather's nice, you can see great scenery such as Mt. Fuji, bay, peninsula and a bird's eye view of the city. 【Taste Tea】 Finally, there will be tea-tasting of green tea, black tea,etc. We will teach you how to make delicious tea too. Join me for a taste of Japanese tea, its culture, and the authentic lifestyle of the Japanese tea farmers! *Please note that due to seasonal harvesting we won't be able to host you everyday, so please contact us before you make any reservation. Do not hesitate to send us a message too if you have further questions with regards to the tour. Thank you for your kind understanding.
strTitle: Visit an Organic Tea Farm in Japan (3-hour tour)

strIntroduction: In this tour to the Okutama region in West Tokyo, we will travel by train from Shinjuku for a little over one hour, and then we will enter the scenic countryside. We will first have lunch in a beautiful Japanese tofu restaurant. After lunch, we will move to a sake brewery nearby and join a guided tour with a larger group. A brewery guide will give explanations in Japanese, and I will translate them into English. The sake brewery, founded in 1702, is perhaps the most famous of ten sake producers in Tokyo Prefecture. Taking advantage of fresh spring water abundant in the mountainous area of Okutama, it continues to make various types of quality sake by capitalizing on the expertise of a brewing master. After the tour, we will move to a tasting room where we can discover different types of sake, freshly out of the brewery, for minimal prices (100 yen to 500 yen per cup). At around 5pm, we will leave to return to Shinjuku. Those who prefer to stay a bit longer to stroll by the river are free to do so. I will give you instructions on how to get back to the city. And for those who need recommendation for a place to have dinner in the city, I would be happy to help you and make a reservation.
strTitle: Enjoy a sake brewery visit and tofu kaiseki lunch in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Join our Osaka Afternoon Tour and discover Osaka's favorite snack - the Okonomiyaki or Takoyaki. You will have a private guide who will take you around Osaka! Go around the city in your preferred pace, and ask many questions! Osaka Castle, a grand structure dating back to the 17th century when Osaka became the center of Japan and began to prosper as a great town of merchants. First, we will visit “Dotonbori” to have a popular snack. It’s the liveliest area in the heart of the old town centre with lots of reasonably-priced restaurants and shops which have replaced the old theaters that used to thrive here. Osaka is called the town of “Kuidaore,” which translates to “eat until you drop.” Just like the locals, we will enjoy eating Okonomiyaki, a Japanese savory pancake containing a variety of ingredients such as cabbage, scallions and eggs, or Takoyaki, a savory round pancake with cooked octopus! Following our meal, we will take a casual stroll down Dotonbori Street and spot many peculiar shop signs along the way. Next we visit Osaka Castle. It boasts gigantic and exquisite stone walls which are the highest in all of Japan. Many sections of the castle have been lost in history. The total length of the stone walls is about 12km or 8miles. We will go around the Osaka Castle Park, up the five-story main tower and take a close look at the unbeatable walls surrounded by two large moats. This is the second Osaka Castle, built after the first Osaka Castle was burnt down during the Winter War and the Summer War in 1615. The stone walls of the first castle have been buried deep under the ground! There are many interesting stories about the castle, so let’s enjoy the sights and listened to the amazing history of the castle. Looking forward to meeting you and enjoying these two famous sights in Osaka!
strTitle: Private Osaka Castle Walking & Dotonbori Food Tour!

strIntroduction: Our cozy Japanese tea house is located steps from the Yasaka shrine in the Gion area, one of Kyoto's most charming traditional neighbourhoods. Our goal is to provide a relaxing and calm environment for first-time visitors to enjoy a traditional tea ceremony and gain insight into traditional Japanese culture. Our 45-minute session starts with a brief introduction to tea and the history of the tea ceremony in Japan. Following this, we give provide a full demonstration of a formal tea ceremony, where you experience a real ceremony first hand. After our demonstration, we will explain the different steps we took and the significance of each step. You will then get to try making your own bowl of tea with a bamboo whisk! We will also serve you the customary snack to enjoy with your tea and show you how it should be eaten. Our experienced tea ceremony masters are fluent in English and would be happy to answer any of your questions during or after the session. Why we love it: -Tea ceremony is named "Kyoto's #7 Things to Do" by the Times Magazine -The traditional ritual is meant to show respect and nobility through slow and graceful movement and good etiquette. -Tea ceremony is held in a cozy tea house, located near Yasaka Shrine in Kyoto's charming Gion district. -1-hour session starts with a brief introduction of tea, followed by a full demonstration of this refined practice with detailed explanations. -Prepare your own tea with a bamboo stick whisk in a tatami tearoom. -Enjoy your tea with a classic Japanese sweet. Time Slots: - from 3pm to 3:45pm - from 4pm to 4:45pm - from 5pm to 5:45pm Private bookings available at: - 1pm - 2pm - 7pm
strTitle: Enjoy an Authentic Tea Ceremony Experience in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Do you want to eat, drink and be merry? The Japanese izakaya is perhaps the perfect combination of a bar and restaurant, and Tokyo has plenty of funny themed izakayas' that love to add entertainment! However, there is one that really stands out, a little-known place in Shinbashi that combines good Japanese food, drinks from around the world, and a "Master" of the izakaya who will treat you to a surreal performance and many tricks! Why we love it: - You will be shocked by the funny performances by the master of this crazy izakaya! - You won't stop laughing when the master begins his show! - You might meet the popular character Anpanman! - You will love the delicious Japanese style dinner! - You may find a trick glass on the table..? - There are some tricks even inside the bathroom! Don't miss it! - Since the master of this crazy restaurant speaks English, you can (and will!) communicate with him in English. - You might be a part of his show! ※ With adult content in parts of the show, this izakaya is not recommended for families with young children. * Additional 500 JPY as entrance fee per person will be required to pay at the izakaya on the reservation date. Earliest reservation time: 18:30 Latest reservation time: 23:00
strTitle: Laugh All Night at the Wackiest Izakaya in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Come hangout around Akihabara and Nakano, and visit many anime shops with me! I'll take you to the best anime stores for premium, maniac, and second-hand products to help you find the anime goods you're looking for! Schedule: 10am: Pickup at the train station near your accommodation in downtown Tokyo. We will decide on lunch and have lunch together. 12pm: Tour Akihabara or Nakano. We will visit different anime stores based on your interests and preferences. 3pm: Sightseeing and shopping at Takeshita Street in Harajuku. There are many dessert shops so we can enjoy some sweets if you'd like. 6pm: Visit the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building Observatory. We will enjoy the beautiful view of Tokyo at night.
strTitle: Hangout and Discover Anime Places in Tokyo in One Day

strIntroduction: No matter how many times you go on it, the Battleship Island will have a different face each time. On sunny days or rainy days, the island becomes a picture,anywhere you take it from. You will probably feel overwhelmed by the force emanating from the ruins! Gunkanjima is a small island located about 20 kilometers from Nagasaki Port. Until 1974, the island served as a coal mine, and more than 5000 residents called the 480 meter long, 150 meter wide island as their home, resulting in an area with the highest population density in history recorded worldwide. In July 2015 the island became a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site as part of the Meiji era industrial legacy. The tour takes about 3 hours in total, however different vessels and cruises are available on different days. Therefore the time schedule depends on the availability. 1) Morning vessel Meeting time: between 8:30 and 10:10 (depends on the vessel) Departure time: between 9:00 and 10:40 (depends on the vessel) Returning time: either 11:30 or 13:00 (depends on the vessel) 2) Afternoon vessel Meeting time: between 12:30 and 13:30 (depends on the vessel) Departure time: between 13:00 and 14:00 (depends on the vessel) Returning time: between 15:30 and 17:15 (depends on the vessel) Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/6v4obc -https://flic.kr/p/6EJmLb -https://flic.kr/p/6v8zRA -https://flic.kr/p/6v8AxQ -https://flic.kr/p/6v4pLc
strTitle: Take a Trip to Gunkanjima by Ship!

strIntroduction: Special offer only for Voyagin guests! We offer this tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers. Don't miss this chance to enjoy half day bus tour exploring some of the best tourist spots in Tokyo in half a day at a valuable price! If you are looking for an adventurous sightseeing bus tour, here it is! This bus tour covers famous sightseeing spots in Tokyo. Enjoy the traditional Japanese garden at the Imperial Palace for the start of your tour, it will take your breath away and you’ll enjoy a peaceful and carefree feeling while you are there. The Sensoji temple and Kaminari-mon gate in Asakusa are a must-see, the magnificent structure of the temple is overwhelming. You will also be able to experience the enthusiastic atmosphere of Tsukiji Fish Market on this bus tour. While you are on the bus, the excitement will be continuous. The bus will pass by Kabukicho, the National Diet, Ameyoko open-air market, Akihabara, Tokyo Skytree, Kabuki-za Theater and much more. It's absolutely amazing to visit all those sightseeing spots in just half a day! --Brief itinerary-- 8:30 Depart from the meeting point at Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower at 8:20) 9:00-9:40 Imperial Palace East Garden Relax and feel the breeze in the greenery. 10:15-11:15 Sensoji Temple, Asakusa Explore one of the most famous temples in Japan! 12:00: Tsukiji Fish Market The tour finishes after arrival at the market and you can explore its shops freely! --Notices-- ・The tour is operated daily from February 15, 2016 to December 31, 2016 (Except Feb 28). ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・A tour assistant in English and Japanese is available. ・A multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese and Thai is available. ・Itinerary order is subject to change depending on traffic and weather. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If a sightseeing spot is closed, we will replace it with an alternative place.
strTitle: Enjoy Half Day Bus Tour Around Best Tourist Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: The Mt. Moiwa Ropeway is a Japanese aerial lift line in Sapporo, Hokkaido. This tour's main point is to experience this ropeway while enjoying the night breeze. The whole trip is around 75 minutes. Here are the details: 1. Pick up We will pick you up at selected hotels. Starts around 7 pm depends on the season and traffic conditions. 2. Mt. Moiwa Ropeway Starts at 8 pm. Lasts for 75 minutes. 3. Drop off We will drop you off at selected hotels around 21:30. Option 1: Adult (age 12 and over) Option 2: Child (age 6-11) Attention please: 1.There are no reserved seats on the bus. 2.There are no seats for children under 6. If you want to book a seat for your child please book as 6-11. 3.It could be delayed depending on the traffic conditions. 4.It could be canceled depending on the weather. 5. Please arrive at the pick-up stop at least 15 minutes ago. 6. Only have Japanese guidance.
strTitle: Enjoy Mt Moiwa Night View Tour in Sapporo, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Japanese soccer is now more famous than ever. Shinji Kagawa, Keisuke Honda, Shunsuke Nakamura, Hidetoshi Nakata and Yuji Nagatomo are some of the best players in the world. It's now part of Japan's culture. Play soccer with us in Tokyo! - The time varies depending on the date. - We can play for about 2-4 hours. - We can play mixed gender soccer games. - If you are a group, you can join as well. - If the weather is rainy, we will play indoor futsal , basketball, badminton, and table tennis. Let's have fun playing soccer in Tokyo!
strTitle: Play soccer with Japanese locals

strIntroduction: This is a Samurai training course, where you will have the chance to dress up in a Samurai's costume and learn the main techniques to use a katakana, the Japanese Samurai sword. After an intense lesson of practice facing off your opponents, swaying your katana and shooting darts, you will have the chance to take pictures in a photoshoot where you can strike your best Samurai pose. Finally, you will receive an actual certificate for your training with your picture on it. This activity also includes a short tea ceremony. Don't miss the chance to learn the secrets of the Samurai and become one yourself! This is a must-try if you always liked Samurai or Ninja and for Japanese culture lovers in general. Experience Japan up close with this activity that will become the highlight of your trip.
strTitle: Become a Samurai and learn to use a sword in Asakusa, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Yokohama Bay is truly one of the best sightseeing spots in Japan. The combination of futuristic new buildings, skyscrapers, theme parks with a giant Ferris Wheel, shopping centers, industrial areas and seaside parks is unique and attracts plenty of visitors all year round. This area, also called "Minato-Mirai", is especially astonishing at night time. There are several places to see the glamourous lights of the bay city from above - for example from the the guest rooms of the nearby skyscraper hotels. This activity will elevate you even higher as you will fly up in the sky to enjoy the panorama in its entire beauty! The helicopter rises up to 400-600 meters and provides a fantastic view over the bay area right after sunset. Even though the flight time is short (5-10 minutes), you will never forget what you'll see! This is the ideal surprise and romantic present for someone you love. The memories from the helicopter trip over Yokohama Bay will be unforgettable. You can choose between several flight time slots: 1) Queen option: Take off around the time of the sunset and enjoy the twilight sky which changes several colours! The silhouette of Mt Fuji against the red sky is magical! This flight takes about 5 minutes. 2) King option: Take off after sunset and enjoy the night view and all the glamorous lights of Yokohama Bay. The contrast with the dark sea is splendid! This flight takes about 5 minutes. 3) Gold option: Take off after sunset and fly for 10 minutes! This is one of the most popular tours. 4)Platinum option: Take off anytime during the business hours and fly for 20 minutes. You can enjoy the breathtaking view of Tokyo and Yokahama 5)Ultimate option: Take off anytime during the business hours and fly for 30 minutes. If you fly at night, you can compare the sunset of Tokyo and Yokohama bay at the same time. 6)Flower bouquet option: Flower bouquet option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. 7)Balloon bouquet option: Balloon bouquet option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. 8)Photo book option: Photo book option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. Helicopters take off between 16:00 and 20:30, depending on the seasonal sunset time. Please note that all tours can have up to 5 passengers and you might be flying together with other guests. If you like to rent the helicopter privately, please enquire about private tours (additional fees will apply). This activity is offered only on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays.
strTitle: Night cruising over Yokohama Bay with a helicopter!

strIntroduction: We offer customized Full day tours specially organized to fit your schedule and places of interest, not only in Nara but also in Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe. Our professional guides can take you to the best spots in Kansai region, but you are free to request additional places of interest or combine parts of different itineraries. Please take the following itineraries only as examples for reference purpose. You can request one of them or suggest your own itinerary which will be delivered to the guide for confirmation of availability. Note that the order of the places visited is not fixed. NARA TOUR: Central Nara 1. Todaiji Temple (one of the oldest temples known for the giant Buddha statue inside) 2. Nara Park (a picturesque park with freely walking deer that you can feed) 3. Wakakusayama (a small mountain behind the park known for sakura trees and a spectacular fire festival in January) 4. Kasuga Taisha (Nara’s most important Shinto shrine) 5. Kofukuji Temple (attractive old temple with a five-storey pagoda) 6. Isuien Garden (scenic Japanese garden with a variety of landscapes) 7. Naramachi (traditional style merchant district with plenty of old houses) 8. Optional: Heijo Palace Site (the site of the former emperor’s residence when Nara was a capital of Japan) NARA TOUR: West and Central Nara 1. Horyuji Temple (a UNESCO site and home of the world’s oldest wooden structures) 2. Toshodaiji Temple (an important temple for the development of Buddhism in Japan) 3. Yakushiji Temple (a beautiful temple with two pagodas) 4. Todaiji Temple (one of the oldest temples known for the giant Buddha statue inside) 5. Naramachi (traditional style merchant district with plenty of old houses) 6. Optional: Heijo Palace Site (the site of the former emperor’s residence when Nara was a capital of Japan) KYOTO TOUR: Best of the best 1. Nijo Castle (the former Kyoto residence of the shogun with spacious Japanese gardens) 2. Kinkakuji Temple (also known as the Golden Pavillion) 3. Ryoanji (one of the most famous Zen rock gardens in Japan) 4. Fushimi Inari Shrine (the shrine known for the thousands of vermillion gates leading up the mountain) 5. Kiyomizu Temple (one of the best known wooden temples in Kyoto with a spectacular panoramic view over the city) 6. Higashiyama slopes (a historic neighbourhood with narrow streets and old houses) KYOTO TOUR: Higashiyama district 1. Ginkakuji Temple (also known as the Silver Pavillion) 2. Philosopher’s path (a famous sakura viewing spot along a small river) 3. Eikando Temple (popular temple with spectacular views over the city) 4. Nanzenji Temple (important Zen temple complex with gardens and other interesting spots like a giant aqueduct) 5. Nishiki market (one of the busiest Kyoto fresh food markets) 6. Gion (Kyoto’s iconic geisha district) 7. Kiyomizu Temple (one of the best known wooden temples in Kyoto with a spectacular panoramic view over the city) KYOTO TOUR: Arashiyama district 1. Kinkakuji Temple (also known as the Golden Pavillion) 2. Ryoanji (one of the most famous Zen rock gardens in Japan) 3. Ninnaji Temple (a beautiful UNESCO registered temple with scenic gardens) 4. Tenryuji Temple (an important Zen temple and another UNESCO site) 5. Arashiyama district (a scenic natural area with many facilities such as the Monkey Park Iwatayama, Okochi Sanso villa and the popular Togetsukyo Bridge) 6. Optional: Sagano sightseeing train or Hozu River boat trip KYOTO TOUR: Southern Kyoto and Uji 1. Toji Temple (home of Japan’s tallest pagoda) 2. Tofukuji Temple (an important Zen temple known for breath-taking autumn colours) 7. Fushimi Inari (the shrine known for the thousands of vermillion gates leading up the mountain) 3. Ujigami Shrine (considered Japan’s oldest Shinto shrine) 4. Byodoin Temple (symbolic for its Buddhist Pure Land garden) 5. Uji Omotesando (a pleasant shopping street specializing in Uji’s high-quality green tea) 6. Uji cormorant fishing (a spectacular experience in the summer evenings – ride a boat and watch professionals using cormorants to catch fish) KYOTO AND NARA TOUR 1. Kiyomizu Temple (one of the best known wooden temples in Kyoto with a spectacular panoramic view over the city) 2. Higashiyama slopes (a historic neighbourhood with narrow streets and old houses) 3. Gion (Kyoto’s iconic geisha district) 4. Nishiki market (one of the busiest Kyoto fresh food markets) 8. Fushimi Inari (the shrine known for the thousands of vermillion gates leading up the mountain) 5. Todaiji Temple (one of the oldest temples known for the giant Buddha statue inside) 6. Isuien Garden (scenic Japanese garden with a variety of landscapes) 7. Naramachi (traditional style merchant district with plenty of old houses) OSAKA TOUR: The Water City 1. Kaiyukan (Osaka’s biggest and most exciting aquarium) 2. Dotonbori (Osaka’s iconic and busiest shopping and restaurant street) 3. Water Bus (Osaka is known as the Water City so river transport is a must-try) 4. Osaka Castle (a reconstruction of one of Japan’s most famous castles) 5. Umeda Sky Building and Grand Front Osaka (popular cities within the cities with panoramic views from their observatories) OSAKA TOUR: Old and New 1. Osaka Castle (a reconstruction of one of Japan’s most famous castles) 2. Shitennoji Temple (one of the oldest temples in Japan) 3. Abeno Harukas (Japan’s tallest skyscraper with an observatory) 4. Shinsekai (a busy shopping and restaurant district with the symbolic tower Tsutenkaku) 5. Sumiyoshi Taisha (an old Shinto shrine with unique architecture) 6. Dotonbori (Osaka’s iconic and busiest shopping and restaurant street) Our customized tours can take you to these and many other places! Grab this opportunity to have your original and best tour! Please note that these tours are based on walking and using public transportation. Also please note that you may need to pay transportation fees and lunch for your guide. strTitle: Customize and embark on a Private Full Day Tour in Kansai

strIntroduction: Enjoy the distinctive atmosphere and learn through the tea ceremony that represents Japan's ultimate hospitality (“Omotenashi spirit”). In a tea ceremony, there is a phrase “Chazen ichimi”. This means “Cha” (tea ceremony) has originated from "Zen". Tea ceremony brings comfort to your heart through facing each other. Zen settles down your heart through facing with yourself. Also, tea ceremony is said to represent the ultimate hospitality (“Omotenashi”). For making a one bowl of Macha, the tea master thinks about the visitors, and select the appropriate flowers and seasonal sweets for the hospitality (“Omotenashi”). Through tea ceremony experience, you can enjoy Japanese traditional culture, the heart of Japanese people, and Japan’s beauty. Our tea room would like to introduce you the wonderful Japanese hospitality, traditional culture, and Matcha green tea. Of course, we will show you a very simple ceremony that can be understood by beginners. We really hope that you will enjoy this Japanese experience with us! Hours of Opreation: from 9:00 – 21:00 9:00 / 10:00 / 11:00 / 12:00 13:00 / 14:00 / 15:00 / 16:00 17:00 / 18:00 / 19:00 / 20:00
strTitle: Enjoy an Elegant Tea Ceremony Experience in Ginza, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Akihabara is truly a rare gem that must not be missed when visiting Japan. Initially it built its fame for extensive electronic shops but with the computer boom over 30 years ago, stores specializing in Anime goods and Manga started to develop. Now Akihabara has turned into a town overflowing with some of the most unusual and unique subcultures. This tour will give you a glimpse into the heart of Akihabara. The places the guide will bring you are the best-suited areas to fully experience the booming Akihabara cultures. These stores listed above are also places that are rarely visited by travelers – making this tour even more unique and authentic. In other words, through this activity, you can enjoy Akihabara differently than other tourists!
strTitle: A Deep Akihabara Tour

strIntroduction: In this “Atakemaru” cruising tour, you can enjoy this exciting professional entertainment show including unlimited eating and drinking—including alcohol—while enjoying the wonderful views of Tokyo Bay, Tokyo Tower, and the Rainbow Bridge. Tokyo bay is one of the most popular night cruising spots in Tokyo and is a place where you can see the beautiful “Rainbow Bridge”. From the ship you can also see the iconic Tokyo Tower, another famous sightseeing spot. The meal will be all-you-can-eat as well as all-you-can-drink. Although vegetarian option are not available, in the past guests have been served more than 10 vegetarian dishes, such as fried potatoes, fried noodles, among others. The onboard performance will be very interesting and exciting to watch because of the high quality of the show. The dancers will sing and dance, and the theme will change every season so that you can enjoy it multiple times throughout the year! Moreover, some of the dancers come from the Japanese top-class entertainment show company “Shiki theatre” so they are professional entertainers! Enjoy the mixture of these dancers together with Tokyo Bay! Itinerary: 19:15 – 19:45 Meet your guide at Hinode Pier boarding area. Bring your reservation confirmation sheet to show to the guide. ※Bookings for participants arriving after the departure time will be canceled!! 19:45 – 21:15 Tokyo Bay Atakemaru Cruise (90 min) You can enjoy a delicious meal, watching a wonderful performance and watching the beautiful view. ※Vegetarian & kid’s menu are unavailable. 21:15 This tour ends at Hinode Pier. Please head to your next destination on your own. You can choose between 3 different plans, outlined below! 1. Ooedo Summer Festival Plan (available June 1 to Sep 30th) this option includes: -cruise fare -show viewing charges -all-you-can-eat & drink with 8 types of food (including alcoholic drinks) 2. Unlimited Food & Drink Plan (available from October 1) this option includes: -cruise fare -show viewing charges -all-you-can-eat & drink with 10 types of food (including alcoholic drinks) -scented sachet 3. Tempura + Unlimited Food & Drinks Plan (available from October 1) this option includes: -cruise fare -show viewing charges -all-you-can-eat & drink with 10 types of food (including alcoholic drinks) -1 plate of tempura -1 plate of pasta
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo Bay Cruise with Entertainment Show!

strIntroduction: Shinjuku Golden-gai Tour - Night Life in Tokyo Golden-gai is an area located in east Shinjuku famous for its many bars – a number that exceeds 300. Outside of a few outliers, most of these bars are incredibly tiny and can seat only four or five customers at one time. Each bar offers its own unique atmosphere and most even feature an odd theme. There are a number of music bars, otaku bars, a video game bar, a nurse bar, karaoke bars, and most anything else you can imagine. Just looking for a relaxing watering hole or a place with a classic Japanese vibe? Don’t worry, there are dozens of those in Golden-gai, as well. Booming as a black market back in the 1950s after the Second World War, the street has since then continually developed its culture of drinking. To this day, Golden-gai is a popular drinking spot for both young and old. However, even Japanese people have difficulty going for a drink in Golden-gai without any introduction. In this activity, we'll visit a few bars in Golden-gai in order to get a little flavor of what the neighborhood has to offer. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/dF9UZT http://flic.kr/p/9vo3JA http://flic.kr/p/dF9VHg http://flic.kr/p/2CLx7Z http://flic.kr/p/gJwQHU http://flic.kr/p/ajNxQi
strTitle: Enjoy Shinjuku Kabuki-cho, Golden-gai Night Tour

strIntroduction: Karuizawa is best known as the summer escapade of wealthy Tokyo residents. The small mountain town was developed as a resort by Western residents of Japan in the 19th century and has a strong Western flavour. You will find a great amount of Catholic churches, attractive little shops, restaurants and plenty of summer villas and loghouses hidden in the forest. A local English-speaking guide will take you on an unforgettable walk around the most scenic spots of Karuizawa's old town, which include the shopping street Karuizawa Ginza, the quiet and moss-covered summer villas district, the picturesque Kumobaike Pond known for its breath-taking autumn colours, and many more! For an additional fee you can visit also Shiraito Waterfull, a beautiful natural spot a few kilometers north of the old town. This 70-meter wide waterfall is unique with the fact that no river flows into it! This tour can be combined with a round-trip Shinkansen ticket from Tokyo Station (or Ueno Station). Karuizawa is just an hour away from Tokyo, easily accessible with the Shinkansen.
strTitle: Explore the old town of Karuizawa with a local guide

strIntroduction: If you have not been to any historical sites in Kyoto yet, this tour is for you! This tour will cover visiting the historical sites in Kyoto in one day! Kyoto was Japan’s capital for over 1,000 years, and the historical scents of Japan still remain. Kyoto has a stunning collection of UNESCO World Heritage sites and also a geisha district. The temples and traditions are outstanding, but the food is also exquisite! This tour will take you to famous tourists spots in Kyoto in one day. A professional guide will show you around safely, while presenting you with important and interesting information about the historical sites and about the city in general. Detailed itineraries: 9:00 Meet up at your hotel 9:15 Fushimi Inari Shrine (60mins) - Fushimi Inari Shrine is an important Shinto shrine in southern Kyoto. - It is famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates, which straddle a network of trails behind its main buildings. - The trails lead into the wooded forest of the sacred Mount Inari, which stands at 233 meters and belongs to the shrine grounds. - Foxes are thought to be Inari's messengers, resulting in many fox statues across the shrine grounds. 11:00 Kiyomizu temple (60mins) - Kiyomizudera is one of the most celebrated temples of Japan. - It was found in 780 on the site of the Otowa Waterfall in the wooded hills, east of Kyoto, and derives its name from the fall's pure water. - In 1994, the temple was added to the list of UNESCO world heritage sites. - Kiyomizudera is best known for its wooden stage that juts out from its main hall, 13 meters above the hillside below. - The stage affords visitors a nice view of the numerous cherry and maple trees below that erupt in a sea of color during the spring and fall, as well as of the city of Kyoto in the distance. - The main hall, which together with the stage was built without the use of nails, houses the temple's primary object of worship, a small statue of the eleven faced, thousand armed Kannon. Kiyomizu temple → Ninen-zaka-Sannen-zaka area → Kodaiji temple → Yasaka Shrine (90mins) - Just downhill from and slightly to the north of Kiyomizu-dera, you will find one of Kyoto’s loveliest restored neighborhood, the Ninen-zaka-Sannen-zaka area. - The name refers to the two main streets of the area: Ninen-zaka and Sannen-zaka, literally ‘Two-Year Hill’ and ‘Three-Year Hill’ (the years referring to the ancient imperial years when they were first laid out). - These two charming streets are lined with old wooden houses, traditional shops and restaurants. - If you fancy a break, there are many tea houses and cafes along this lane. - Kodaiji is an outstanding temple in Kyoto's Higashiyama District. - It was established in 1606 in memory of Toyotomi Hideyoshi, one of Japan's greatest historical figure, by Hideyoshi's wife Nene who is also enshrined at the temple. - Yasaka Shrine is one of the most famous shrines in Kyoto. Found over 1350 years ago, the shrine is located between the popular Gion District and Higashiyama District, and is often visited by tourists walking between the two districts. - You will have lunch somewhere around this area. - If you have any preferences or need a recommendation, feel free to ask the guide! 13:30 Gion (60mins) - Gion is Kyoto's most famous geisha district, located around Shijo Avenue between Yasaka Shrine in the east and the Kamo River in the west. - It is filled with shops, restaurants and ochaya (teahouses), where geiko(Kyoto dialect for geisha) and maiko (geiko's apprentices) entertain their customers with traditional dances, songs, and games. 15:15 Kinkakuji (60misn) - Visit the Golden Pavilion, a Zen temple, whose top floors are completely covered in gold leaf - It was the retirement villa of the shogun, Ashikaga Yoshimitsu, and according to his will it became a Zen temple of the Rinzai sect after his death in 1408. - It is a detailed architecture incorporating three distinct styles of shinden, samurai, and zen. 17:00 Arrive at Kyoto Station Why we love it: - Don't have enough time to travel around? No worries! Visit famous sightseeing sites in one day! - Take a tour with a knowledgeable English-speaking local guide with years of experience. - Strap on your adventurous spirit and immerse yourself in Kyoto - You will never forget the beauty of Kyoto! - You will enjoy wandering around Kyoto with the professional guide, since the professional guide will show you around the area with important and interesting information, and also about the Japanese culture! - Don't miss this opportunity to travel around Kyoto in one day! - Since this tour is a one day trip, you can do other activities on the next day! Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! Photos by: - https://flic.kr/p/tAUJE - https://flic.kr/p/ifGEsp - https://flic.kr/p/enJMBg - https://flic.kr/p/6xnSus - https://flic.kr/p/nk2NGx - https://flic.kr/p/6v4cji
strTitle: 1 Day Tour Around Historical Sites in Kyoto

strIntroduction: - Meet up at Asakusa Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. You will experience the proper way to visit the temple and shrine! You can wish and pray for your success at temples. You will also see the new symbol of Japan, the Tokyo Sky Tree. At Asakusa, you will visit… - Kaminarimon gate - Nakamise shopping street - Sensoji temple and Asakusa shrine After that, you will take a 35-minute river cruise from Asakusa to the Japanese Traditional garden of Hamarikyu, which is a typical Japanese styled garden with a pond in center. You can see the mixture of traditional and modern parts of Tokyo which consists of beautiful seasonal flowers, a tranquil atmosphere and modern high-rised buildings. You can try and taste matcha tea with sweets if you would like at a tea house on the pond. - Move to Tsukiji fish market You can have lunch in the outer market at Tsukiji. You can enjoy fresh and delicious sushi at reasonable prices. We’ll visit another temple, Tsukiji Honganji. - Take the subway to Nijubashi, the bridge of the Imperial Palace. The professional guide will explain to you about the Japanese Imperial family. - Finish at Yurakucho area which is filled with local business men and women. You can enjoy shopping at Ginza which is a luxurious shopping area. You can also have a drink at a Yakitori alley if you would like!
strTitle: Explore The East Side of Tokyo in One Day!
